content.original:
The Pouncer was originally a test bed design that was upgraded to combat specifications on the orders of then-IlKhan Ulric Kerensky, as it was realized that a more mobile 'Mech was needed when combating Inner Sphere forces. The Pouncer is built on a lightweight DSAM Endo 4 Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a 240 XL engine which gives it a maximum speed of 97.2 km/h. The 'Mech's mobility is enhanced with five Grandthrust Mk. Four jump jets that allow it to jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. For protection from enemy fire, the Pouncer has a respectable six tons of Forging ZM15 Ferro-Fibrous armor. Overall, the Pouncer is an excellent OmniMech with fifteen and a half tons of pod space, allowing it to carry a wide variety of weapons payloads. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Rabid Coyote was designed by scientists from Clan Coyote to be a complement to other, slower BattleMechs. First deployed in 3066, the 'Mech was deployed in an effort to stave off the slow decline of the previous decades that had befallen the Clan that created the OmniMech. With an eye towards cost, the Rabid Coyote employs a standard fusion engine, though it does make use of an Endo Steel internal structure and eight and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Curiously, as the 'Mech is intended to be a bodyguard for larger 'Mechs like the Savage Coyote, front-line warriors spurn the design because they do not wish to be seen merely as ''support''. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
The Razorback is a design that excels at little, but is similarly deficient in few areas. Though the design is rather slow for a 'Mech of its size, it is rarely the slowest 'Mech on the field, either. Because of the 'Mech's general reliance on ballistic and missile weaponry, it does not have to worry about overheating under normal circumstances but is dependent on supply trains. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.content:
Razorback - это конструкция, которая мало в чем преуспевает, но в то же время имеет мало недостатков. Хотя и довольно медленный для мехов такого размера, он редко бывает самый медленным на поле боя. Из-за того, что мех в основном использует баллистическое и ракетное оружие, ему не приходится беспокоиться о перегреве в обычных условиях, но он зависим от подвоза боеприпасов. Особенность: Узкий/низкий профиль Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.99

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Produced by Leopard Armor for the Word of Blake, the Red Shift is one of many new BattleMechs being fielded by the Word of Blake Militia. The Red Shift is designed to spot for the Padilla artillery tank, which is also built by Leopard Armor, with its TAG target designator. The Red Shift is built on a lightweight Leopard Mark I Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a GM 180 XL engine that pushes the 'Mech's top speed up to 151.2 km/h. To give the 'Mech the ability to protect itself from advanced electronic warfare systems, the Red Shift has a Guardian ECM Suite. For protection from conventional weapons, the Red Shift has four tons of 1/Star Slab Ferro-Fibrous armor. To dissipate the 'Mech's scant waste heat, the Red Shift is outfitted with ten heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Following the surprise invasion of Huntress, most of the Clans looked to upgrade the defenders of their homeworlds. In so doing, Clan Cloud Cobra decided to upgrade their aging Rifleman IICs. The IIC 3 first entered service in the early part of 3062. Based upon the original design, it nonetheless uses two Model HHC-30 Ultra Autocannon/2s to plink at a target from long range. Any opponent who believes he or she is facing a IIC 2 is quickly surprised, however, when the IIC 3 opens up with its paired Series 4D-2 Heavy Large Lasers. Twenty one double heat sinks keep this design cool-running. This rebuilt version still mounts the Active Probe. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
An assault grade fire support mech, the Salamander entered production in 3055. An 80 ton mech, the Salamander is built around a 320 rated Light Engine and an Endo Steel Skeleton, allowing it to carry 43 tons of weapons and equipment. The Salamander PPR-7S is armed with a trio of Artemis IV enhanced LRM-15’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers act as back up weapons. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
Created by VEST in 3064 to hunt down the stolen 001 model Sasquatch, the 002 is faster and can take a heavier level of punishment. Hand made for the Solaris arenas, the SQS-TH-002 is an 85 ton Assault Mech powered by a 425 rated XXL Engine. Primarily armed with a Gauss Rifle, the 002 has 3 Medium X-Pulse Lasers and a Small Laser as secondary weapons. A Large Shield and improved armour protection allow the Mech to weather a great deal of punishment. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower
content.prevOriginal: A Solaris VII BattleMech, the Sasquatch was to be VEST's entry into the Assault 'Mech category. After producing a prototype 'Mech, someone stole it out of the VEST facility. VEST immediately redesigned the Sasquatch to destroy the stolen 'Mech. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
Based on the Golden Age Storm Giant, the Scylla is an updated model developed by the Steel Vipers as a second line Battlemech. A 100 ton mech with a 400 rated XL Engine, the Scylla SCY-1 is armed with a pair of LRM-20’s and an ER Large Laser. An LB-10X and a pair of ER Medium Lasers deter opponents from closing range with the Scylla. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original:
The Sentinel is a medium BattleMech built by Defiance Industries, originally under exclusive contract for the Lyran Commonwealth, as an infantry support and installation defense 'Mech. While initially pleased to have a then Terran Hegemony controlled factory manufacturing the 'Mech exclusively for the LCAF, the Lyrans were less so when a Star League Council amendment in 2652 permitted the Star League Defense Force to purchase a highly advanced version of the design which Houses Steiner, Marik and Davion would not receive until years later. The Sentinel was one of many designs to suffer from the technological decline of the Succession Wars era, with Defiance first losing the ability to manufacture its advanced weapon systems before discontinuing production entirely in 3014 due to lack of both parts and interest. Rather than disappear from the battlefield, the Sentinel now began to appear in increasing numbers thanks to ComStar and its massive stockpile of SLDF material, both providing the design to the Draconis Combine prior to the War of 3039 and using it to help outfit its Com Guards. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

content.original:
One of the first Mechs to incorporate Stealth Armor, the Sha Yu entered production in 3063. A 40 ton Mech, the Sha Yu or ''Shark'' is designed as a Scout and Sniper platform, for the Shadow Lances. Powered by a 280 rated XL Engine, the Sha Yu SYU-2B is clad in Stealth Armor with an onboard Guardian ECM Suite. Paired ER Large and ER Medium Lasers form the bulk of the Mechs weapons while a TAG adds the capability for directing artillery strikes. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original:
The Shootist first saw service in 2621 as a heavily armored, electronic warfare-capable command 'Mech for SLDF Royal BattleMech Regiments. However, the Shootist's upgraded electronic suites proved no match for the cutting edge of electronic warfare of its own time. When the BattleMaster eclipsed the Shootist in its intended role as a command vehicle merely ten years after its introduction, the SLDF changed the Shootist's mission parameters. The Shootist's balanced mix of weapons and speed, and its heavy armor allowed it a new role: juggernaut for close-combat heavy lances, and later, a bodyguard unit for command lances. This role never proved favorable to the longevity of the Shootist; since the Succession Wars, this BattleMech is rarely seen outside of the ComGuards, Word of Blake Militia, and ancient Clan Brian Caches. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

content.original:
The Snake is a 'Mech that was built under the aegis of an Elemental hunter. With the power of hindsight though the Snake is clearly designed to hunt Inner Sphere Battle Armor suits. The 'Mech is built using a Vox 225 XL Engine to move at a top speed of 86.4 kph. The Snake also has a jumping capability of one hundred and fifty meters making it capable of outmaneuvering any battle armor suit and also keeping it on par with most medium 'Mechs. The Snake is also armored with seven tons of armor and uses double heat sinks to cool the 'Mech's excess heat. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The Solitaire is a fast, heavily armored light BattleMech. The twenty five-ton design is one of the fastest in existence, allowing it to pick off enemy units that stray too far from support like a lioness hunting a pack of wildebeest. The Solitaire is capable of operating far from supply lines, as it carries an all-energy weapon complement and four and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: Like many designs lost during the Succession Wars, the Sorcerer design saw new life in the decades after the discovery of the Helm Memory Core. The Capellan Confederation began production of their own variant in 3062. The Sorcerer 2L retains the 380XL Engine, Guardian ECM Suite, arm-mounted PPCs, and fifteen of the original Double Heat Sinks; the design adds a pair of Ceres Arms Plasma Rifles with three tons of ammunition, a quartet of Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Medium Lasers, and a pair of Sunglow Prism-Optic Small Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
With the reintroduction of Helm Core LosTech, the Taurian Defense Force found themselves lagging behind their neighbours. Just as they did during the Age of War, the Taurians turned to the home grown Talos. With a reputation as an easy to maintain and easy to manufacture mech, the design was just what the TDF needed. Lacking the resources to turn the newly redesigned Talos into a viable production model, the Taurians enlisted the aid of their neighbours, in exchange for joining the ongoing Trinity Alliance negotiations. Aided by the expertise of Capellan engineers and financial investment from the Magistracy of Canopus, Vandenburg started limited manufacturing of the Talos; at their New Vandenburg plant: in late 3059. The formal signing of the Trinity Alliance, in 3062; awarded production licenses to both Majesty Metals and Detroit Consolidated Mech Works. Both companies swiftly opened their own lines, producing multiple variants of the Talos for their own use and for export further afield. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The Thanatos-4T is a closer-range brawler variant of the Thanatos that reduces the engine size in order to carry a significantly better close range payload, consisting of the original's MRM-20 combined with a massive LB-20X Autocannon and 4 Medium Pulse Lasers. It keeps a similar armor profile and keeps the jump jet mobility of the original Thanatos-4S. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Built for both ComStar and the Word of Blake in 3067, the Thug 12E is a redesign of the Thug 11E with the aim of extending it’s accuracy and range. The traditional PPCs have been upgraded to ER PPCs and an improved C3 computer has been added. To make the change to a C3i computer, a double heat sink, one ton of ammunition, and the corresponding CASE were removed. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The Thunder is the first heavy ’Mech designed and produced by a Capellan manufacturer following the Clan invasion. Powered by a 350 XL Engine, the 70 ton Thunder THR-2L is armed with an LB-20X along with two Extended-Range Medium Lasers, a Streak SRM-6 rack and an Extended-Range Small Laser. TSM boosts the Mechs performance when running hot while Guardian ECM and 13 tons of Stealth Armor protect the Thunder, with CASE mounted in the Left Torso. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original: The Thunderbolt-8S is an attempt to streamline and simplify the Thunderbolt's typically eclectic loadout. It drops every weapon off the mech and replaces them all with a pair of ER PPCs with a PPC Capacitor charging them further. An Angel ECM suite keeps the mech protected while 4 jump jets keep it mobile in any terrain. 16 double heat sinks try their best to keep the mech cool but generally speaking aren't enough for aggressive pilots. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
The Tomahawk is an assault-class OmniMech designed by Clan Wolf in 3065. By September of that year, a few prototypes had been built and were being tested in trial runs. One these prototypes was piloted by Nathan Wolf in a Circle of Equals on Tamar when he attained the rank of Star Colonel. Although he was victorious against a Thor, it was noted that the Tomahawk still suffered from numerous system errors and gremlins and was not yet ready for mass production. Still, Nathan retained the 'Mech for his subsequent assignment to Omega Galaxy and successfully piloted it in combat on Novo Cressidas in the Star's End system on 11 April 3064. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Produced by Maverick Industries after Operations Serpent and Bulldog, the TsarBomba is an attempt to improve the flexibility and survivability of artillery units. Noting the loss of many Arrow IV equipped units and the slaughter of their crews during Clan breakthroughs, the Maverick Industries design teams looked for ways to improve the situation. With a license to produce the Hollander BZK-F3 already secured, it was decided to produce an upgraded model that utilised an XL Engine to mount the Arrow IV launcher. Modern artillery tactics called for the deployment of anti air and anti mech units to protect the precious assets, so Maverick only mounted a Small Pulse Laser on the mech, augmented by a TAG; so that the Hollander could handle infantry infiltrators and spot for either it’s own launcher or the rest of it’s lancemates. The designs speed was judged sufficient for it to evade other threats that might threaten the mech, especially with it’s armour unable to stand up to much punishment. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

This Free Worlds League variant upgrades the autocannon to an Ultra Autocannon/10 and the laser to an ER Small Laser. This is all made possible by the upgrade to five tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor and the removal of the eleventh heat sink. While the ultra-class autocannon provides superior firepower, it can also eat through the single ton of ammunition at an alarming rate. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

A SRM-6 launcher provides close combat capabilities and a pair of Machine Guns provide anti-infantry capabilities. A Beagle Active Probe allows the 'Mech to detect hidden units and protects the Uziel from ambushes. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original:
The Uziel is not a ground breaking BattleMech design, especially when compared with some of the new designs to come out of Hesperus II. It does, however, incorporate several newly developed weapon systems into an effective combat package. The Uziel carries a LB-2X Autocannon for hit and fade attacks which is backed up by a Large Pulse Laser at range and a bevy of ER lasers and a SRM-6 for close-range assault. Backed up with respectable speed and jump jets for maneuverability, the Uziel breaks no new ground but is a clean and effective design nonetheless. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower
content.prevOriginal:
The Uziel is not a ground breaking BattleMech design, especially when compared with some of the new designs to come out of Hesperus II. Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower
content.content:
Uziel не является новаторской конструкцией боевого меха, особенно по сравнению с некоторыми новыми конструкциями, появившимися на Гесперусе II. Однако он включает в себя несколько недавно разработанных систем вооружения. Uziel несет автопушку LB-2X для атак типа «бей и беги», которая поддерживается большим импульсным лазером на расстоянии и множеством лазеров ER и SRM-6 для атаки с близкого расстояния. Подкрепленный приличной скоростью и реактивными двигателями для маневренности, Uziel не открывает ничего нового, но, тем не менее, это добротная и эффективная конструкция. Особенность: Капюшон Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.04

content.original: The Valkyrie II project originated as an assignment for two NAIS student design teams to create a new heavy scout and skirmisher mech based on the Valkyrie VLK-QA. A rivalry between the two teams and outside pressures from Davion bureaucrats pushed both designs far beyond a replacement for the VLK-QA. Corean Enterprises was contracted to construct the Valkyrie II-2A which sports a 300 rating Light Fusion Engine, five Jump Jets, an ER Large Laser, a quartet of ER Medium Lasers, and nearly thirteen tons of armor. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original:
Based on the King Crab, and built in the same factory that first produced the Mackie, the Vanquisher has a legendary pedigree. The Vanquisher has its genesis in the development of reverse engineered Improved C3 Computers. Once the Word of Blake had perfected their version of C3i, Cameron St. Jamais contacted Skobel MechWorks and contracted them to produce a 'Mech that would showcase the features of the new system. The Vanquisher was the result of that request. In order to allow it to carry as heavy a payload as possible without sacrificing durability, the 'Mech is built on a Hollis Alteration Mark VI Endo Steel that carries a Vlar 300 fusion engine, which propels the 'Mech to a top speed of 54 km/h. The Vanquisher is protected by nineteen and a half tons of armor with CASE in both side torsos to protect the 'Mech from going down in an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Changes in the way the Clans fight since they made contact with the Inner Sphere led scientists from Clan Steel Viper to revisit the Vapor Eagle. They stripped out all the weaponry, but left everything else alone. This variant is effective at long range, as it mounts a Clan Mk. XVII ER PPC. The Fang Series-A ATM 3 replaced the Machine Guns of the original, though it only mounts one ton of ammunition, so the launcher loses the all-important flexibility of the Advanced Tactical Missile System. For close range, three Series 5K Heavy Medium Lasers provide a powerful punch, while a pair of Pattern D-II SRM-2 launchers add more damage potential. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
A more recent variant of the Victor produced on New Valencia, the 10D is an excellent close combat 'Mech. The 10D variant has a powerful Ultra Autocannon/20 as its primary weapon. This is supported by two ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-4 to finish off a damaged target. The 10D is also capable of jumping up to one hundred and twenty meters, making it an excellent urban combat machine. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper
content.prevOriginal:

The 10D is also capable of jumping up to one hundered and twenty meters, making it an excellent urban combat machine. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper
content.content:
Более поздний вариант Victor, производимый на Новой Валенсии, 10D является превосходным мехом ближнего боя. Вариант 10D оснащен мощной Ultra Autocannon/20 в качестве основного оружия. Её поддерживают два средних лазера увеличенной дальности и Streak SRM-4 для добивания поврежденной цели. 10D также способен прыгать на высоту до ста двадцати метров, что делает его отличной машиной для городского боя. Особенность: Прочный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.14

Лимит приводов рук: Right Upper

content.original:
The 10L is armed with a Gauss Rifle as its primary long ranged weapon. This is backed up by three ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 launcher for close combat. The 'Mech carries an ECM Suite as part of its Stealth Armor system, which allows it to reduce its radar signature and makes the 'Mech harder to target, especially at long range, and also four jump jets that allow the 'Mech to seize the high ground, making this variant of the Victor an excellent sniper. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

content.original:
The 10S is armed with a mammoth Heavy Gauss Rifle, split between the right and center torsos, supported by a standard Gauss Rifle in the right arm, SRM-4 in the left torso and twin ER Medium Lasers in the left arm. Carrying the usual Victor weapons load-out in addition to the Heavy Gauss Rifle is made possible through the use of an Endo-Steel frame and fragile 320-rated Extralight engine. Lacking the jump jets most Victors are renowned for, the 10S mounts an Anti-Missile System and is clad in thirteen tons of standard plating. The 10S carries three tons of Heavy Gauss reloads, two of standard Gauss rounds and a single ton of SRM and AMS ammo each. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Production began on the 11D on New Valencia during the FedCom Civil War. Powered by a Light Engine, the 11D adds an additional ton and a half of armor over that on the 10D. Two ER Large Lasers provide long-range firepower and the Streak SRM-4 is retained. The autocannon is replaced with a Rotary Autocannon/5 and three tons of ammunition in a CASE-protected bin. A C3 Slave allows integration with a C3 unit. Fifteen double heat sinks are able to effectively manage the heat levels. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
Introduced in 2940, the Viper is a 40 ton OmniMech that emphasizes speed and armour, with only 8.5 tons of podspace available for weapons. A 320 rated XL Engine powers the Viper and 8 Jump Jets are hardwired into the chassis, further improving the mobility. The Viper H is armed with paired ER Medium Lasers and Heavy Medium Lasers. A pair of Small Pulse Lasers and an AMS fill the remaining podspace. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This variant switched the previous rocket weapons to a pair of ATM6 and also downgraded the medium pulse laser to ER small lasers. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original:
The 4L variant of the Warhammer was introduced by StarCorps in 3067, towards the end of the FedCom Civil War. Intended for use by the Capellan Confederation's new Shadow Lances, it completely strips the armor, the engine, and heat sinks from the original. Instead the variant mounts an XL Engine and double heat sinks, and stealth armor to improve the survivability in combat. The 4L Warhammer's primary weapons were two ER PPCs for long-range combat, backed up by four Medium Pulse Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 launcher for close range combat. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

The 4L Warhammer's primary weapons were two ER PPCs for long-range combat, backed up by four Medium Pulse Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 launcher for close range combat. Особенность: Встроенный прожектор Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.1

Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Fusion Core, the Warhammer WHM-8D is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers, ER Small Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 deter opponents from closing in. CASE and a C3 Slave round out the design. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Standing at ten meters tall, the Watchman is a 'Mech that was born of necessity. The idea for the design came when the bulk of the AFFS was moved to the Clan front. Because this seriously undermined the ability of the Federated Suns to keep its borders secure, the Watchman was designed to be distributed to militia units within the border marches to bulk up their strength. In its own right the Watchman is a durable and reliable 'Mech that is built with off the shelf components and is very easy to repair. The 'Mech is armored with eight and a half tons of standard armor, has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. This, combined with the Watchman's varied arsenal, makes it an excellent trooper or trainer. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: The Wraith marked Curtiss Militech's entry into BattleMech production. When the design was announced, many felt that the design would be little more than a walking water cooler. What the critics got was a shock. The Wraith is a 'Mech that, when properly employed, can wreak havoc on an enemy with its astounding speed and maneuverability. It is built around a massive LTV 385 XL Engine that allows it to reach speeds of just under 119 kph. The Wraith has a simple, yet effective, pulse weapons payload. Pulse laser weaponry allows the Mech to negate most of the side effects on accuracy that are introduced by the Wraith's heavy use of jump jets, making it incredibly accurate and powerful for such a lightly armed Mech. A modification of the Wraith made by the Word of Blake, the TR3 replaces the two Medium Pulse Lasers with two ER Medium Lasers while one of the jump jets is removed to make room for an improved C3 computer, making the Wraith an incredibly powerful point 'Mech for units equipped with C3i equipment. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
The Yu Huang, named for the Jade Emperor that rules the Heavenly Court in the ancient Chinese pantheon, debuted with the promise from Sun-Tzu Liao that 'it shall sit in judgment over a battlefield, meting out justice to those who would transgress against us'. To live up to the promise of the Chancellor of the Capellan Confederation, the Yu Huang carries some of the most advanced technologies available at the time of its initial production. The Yu Huang is built on a Chariot Type II Endo Steel chassis and carries a Hermes 360 XL engine that gives the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. The 'Mech is capable of jumping up to one hundred and twenty meters with its four Rodan 90 jump jets. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The 9T variant of the Zeus was introduced in 3062 just prior to the civil war and carried the 6T to its next logical step. As its primary weapon, the 9T carried an ER PPC, backed by an LRM-15 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system for greater missile accuracy and twice as much ammunition capacity. Also, for long-range combat, the 9T carried an ER Large Laser, while for close combat the 'Mech was armed with two Medium Pulse Lasers and an ER Medium Laser. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Drawn on a blank sheet of paper in a museum on Terra, this marvelous craft was inspired by an ancient airplane that followed a curious design ethos. Rather than designing a plane and then mounting weapons, They designed a gun before mounting a plane on it. The same holds true here. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 160 15 Left 125 15 Right 125 15 Rear 100 15 Total 525 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - PPC

content.original: The Ajax Assault Tank is an Omni-capable combat vehicle that is the follow-up to GM's Challenger X MBT. The Ajax follows on the heels of the successful Manteuffel OmniVehicle. The Ajax is slow, only capable of attaining speeds up to 54 km/h. Since speed is not its defense, the designers gave the Ajax nineteen tons of armor. The room for all of this armor comes from the XL Engine the Ajax uses for power. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: Boss, Alacorns are one of the few tanks you will ever hear me say can reasonably stand toe to toe with a 'Mech. Their armor is incredibly thick and they are reasonably armed, a wise MechWarrior would stay weary of them.

content.original: The Daimyo HQ was a heavy theater command unit utilized by the Draconis Combine. The first Daimyo was fielded in 2796 at the beginning of the Succession Wars by Jinjiro Kurita, who used the vehicle during the Kentares Massacre. While the Coordinator attended executions in person, the Daimyo HQ's crew transmitted the data to ComStar representatives on the planet who then sent the data through the whole Inner Sphere. When Jinjiro discovered the treason, the whole crew was executed. Daimyo production ceased between the years 3027 and 3063 because the unit's communication system technology become a form of Lostech. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 245 25 Left 140 25 Right 140 25 Rear 90 25 Turret 155 25 Total 770 125 Quirk: Battle Computer B2000
content.prevOriginal: The Turhan was first built for the Terran Hegemony in 2530 by Dieron's Buhallin Military Products. The company, known for its wheeled vehicles, built the Turhan to answer the HAF's need for an urban assault vehicle to support its infantry in urban environments. The vehicle acted as an Armored Personnel Carrier, deploying troops from its large infantry transport bay. The vehicle is protected by seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, which ensured its cargo arrived at the designation intact. The Turhan's principal weaponry was its twin Large Lasers which were mounted in its turret. Mounted with the lasers were a pair of Machine Guns. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Bailey armored car is a Gienah Automotive-produced civilian security vehicle first marketed in the mid-thirty-first century. The company exploited recovered Star League technology to enhance vehicle performance. The Bailey was designed to cope with battle armor-equipped infantry, which had steadily become more common. Aside for transporting high-value cargo, it can be used as makeshift armor infantry transport. The Bailey was designed to resist battle armor because of a daring raid that saw several robbers using Gray Death Standard battle armor to open a Knox armored car carrying payroll. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 80 15 Left 55 15 Right 55 15 Rear 55 15 Turret 50 15 Total 295 75 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Developed in 3062 during the FedCom Civil War and produced by New Samarkand Metals, this version of the Behemoth removes all the standard weaponry. It carries a pair of Ultra AC/10s, a pair of MRM-10 launchers, and a pair of Artemis IV FCS enhanced SRM-6 launchers in the turret. To provide some additional long range firepower, it mounts a pair of LRM-5 launchers with Artemis guidance systems on the front of its hull. Introduced in 2952, the Behemoth was designed for increased firepower and heavy armor rather than speed or manoeuvrability. The design allowed the Behemoth to engage both distant and short-range targets, while allowing it to stand up to almost any type of unit possible. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 250 50 Left 190 50 Right 190 50 Rear 185 50 Turret 245 50 Total 1060 250 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Blizzard Hover Transport was designed by Kressly Warworks and was first produced in 3054. While the Blizzard was intended for use against the Clans, it gained notoriety in the Chaos March and its effectiveness was realized in the Capellan-St. Ives War. This variant dates to the late 3060s and is intended to be an escort for other Blizzards. It lacks the infantry bay and upgrades the armor protection utilizing Ferro-Fibrous technology. Instead of the LRM, the Black Blizzard mounts pairs of SRM-4s and Machine Guns in the turret. It also includes a Guardian ECM Suite to protect the unit from enemy electronics. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. The Challenger was a joint effort between Kallon Industries and General Motors; rather than possibly losing out on lucrative contracts trying to outdo one another, the two corporations teamed up to create a main battle tank that could stand up to a BattleMech. The tank was produced on Kirklin, Kathil, and Salem. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: Under-funded units unable to keep up with the expensive maintenance required to keep the Shrike launcher in optimum condition have been known to replace it with a cheaper SRM-4 launcher, using the extra space for a pair of machine guns and half-ton of ammunition. The Chaparral Missile Artillery was introduced by Grumman Industries in 2611. Designed to provide artillery support for the SLDF ground forces, the Chaparral frequently operated in places the larger Mobile Long Tom couldn't reach. The Chaparral was loved by the troops it supported because the shorter range of the Arrow IV meant that it was closer to the conflict and the missiles arrived more quickly. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 25 Left 90 25 Right 90 25 Rear 180 25 Total 460 100 Quirk: 360° Torso Twist

content.original: Despite the original being introduced in 2564 updated Condors are still in production as of the start of the 32nd Century. Substantial armor of at least six tons and various mid and long range weapon packages keep the Condor relevant. A heavy cavalry unit designed for rapid reaction to a shifting battle, the Condor was one of the few heavy hover tanks available at the time of it's introduction. This immense hovercraft is capable of a flank speed of 129 km/h and a cruising speed of 86 km/h, making it one of the fastest vehicles in its weight class. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 150 25 Left 140 25 Right 140 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 145 25 Total 655 125 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: This unusual version of the Demolisher tank debuted during the FedCom Civil War. It replaces the AC/20's and some armor with a pair of Arrow IV missile launchers and seven tons of ammunition. For defense against close range attacks it mounts a pair of medium lasers. Tall, squat, and using four treads, the Demolisher has a well-earned, though sometimes exaggerated, reputation as one of the most deadly vehicles on the battlefield. Designed to counteract the increasing scarcity of 'Mechs during the Succession Wars, the Demolisher became popular, especially on worlds where BattleMechs were not available. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 210 40 Left 140 40 Right 140 40 Rear 100 40 Turret 190 40 Total 780 200 Quirk: Improved Sensors

content.original: The Donar Assault Helicopter is a versatile VTOL that is useful in a variety of roles, similar in concept to the Inner Sphere's Warrior. The helicopter is operated by a pilot and copilot/gunner seated in a tandem configuration, with a limited amount of redundancy in both positions should one or the other be knocked out. Three tons of Compound A2F ferro-fibrous armor keeps its safe from small arms fire, and its rotary blades will remain operational even when hit by 40mm caliber weapons. The well-armored hide also gives the Donar a good survival rate in low-altitude crashes. Like most VTOLs, the Donar is fast, capable of achieving up to 151 km/h. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. content.original: The Enyo Strike Tank is a combat vehicle produced by Clan Hell's Horses. Following the success of the XL Engine variant of the Mars, Khan Malavai Fletcher ordered his scientist caste to come up with a main battle tank that could take advantage of the speed a lightweight engine could bring. His successor, James Cobb, liked the idea and maintained the mandate for such a proof of concept. The result of the scientists' labor is the Enyo. It can hit speeds up to 97 km/h, which enables it to keep up with many Clan medium 'Mechs. Seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor protect the tank, allowing it to withstand some punishment, though speed is its best defense. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 170 30 Left 145 30 Right 145 30 Rear 125 30 Turret 145 30 Total 730 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Ferret Light Scout VTOL was first introduced to House Davion troops in 2901 and later adopted by House Marik, House Steiner and certain Periphery powers. The vehicle serves as an advanced scout with the ability to monitor enemy troop movements and radio in artillery strikes. Thanks to its speed, a single Ferret can patrol a front of up to twenty kilometers long, moving quickly from one area to the next. The vehicle is lightly armored and a hit from nearly any kind of 'Mech weaponry will destroy the Ferret. However, the Ferret's job is to avoid combat, and its agility allows it to remain outside the effective range of the enemy's weapons until reinforcements arrive. Besides reconnaissance and artillery spotting, the Ferret's cargo capacity also makes it suitable for transport and rescue operations. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 15/23 Hex: 450/690 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 40 5 Left 10 5 Right 10 5 Rear 10 5 Total 80 25 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: The Fulcrum Hover Tank was first brought into production by Cyclops Incorporation of Skye in 3057. The vehicle was initially stationed along the Lyran Alliance's Periphery and Free Worlds League borders, where its low maintenance needs were a boon for worlds that had not seen much of the newest technological advances. The vehicle had continued to perform well during the FedCom Civil War and during the early Jihad. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. content.original: The first of two variants that date to the late 3060s, the ERSL is built on Dicallus and is popular with Taurian Concordat militia units based in cities. The simple modification replaces the medium laser with a pair of ER Small Lasers. The Gabriel's main role is reconnaissance and intelligence gathering, carrying information back to its parent unit quickly thanks to its high speed, and the vehicle mounts advanced communications and sensor equipment for longer-ranged satellite network transmissions. While the Gabriel only carries a single ton of armor, instead of standard or even ferro-fibrous plate, the designers used Ferro-Aluminum armor, normally reserved for aerospace fighters. The front, back, and turret carry the bulk of this meager protection, at the expense of the vehicle's sides. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 13/20 Hex: 390/600 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 55 5 Left 20 5 Right 20 5 Rear 10 5 Turret 25 5 Total 130 25 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.original: A light combat vehicle that first saw production in 2692 the Galleon proved to be an economical means of supporting infantry and BattleMechs. With a top speed faster than most 'Mechs, the Galleon was mobile but generally lacked protection, early models carrying only three and a half tons of armor. After the Exodus, these tracked vehicles mostly fell into the possession of the Draconis Combine and the Free Worlds League. The Galleon is often paired with the Harasser Missile Platform. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. It was designed by Defiance Industries as a cheap, reliable and effective combat vehicle to provide covering fire support for combat units withdrawing from the front lines. content.original: Rarely seen in the field, the Jaguar II is a specialist variant of the Jaguar that debuted in the closing stages of the Civil War. Downgrading the engine to a 225 XL, allowed the Kali Yama engineers to mount a targeting computer, enhancing the accuracy of the Jaguars weapons. The lower speed is a controversial choice, with most Jaguar crews preferring the higher speed of the original model. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.content: Rarely seen in the field, the Jaguar II is a specialist variant of the Jaguar that debuted in the closing stages of the Civil War. Downgrading the engine to a 225 XL, allowed the Kali Yama engineers to mount a targeting computer, enhancing the accuracy of the Jaguars weapons. The lower speed is a controversial choice, with most Jaguar crews preferring the higher speed of the original model. Гусеничная платформа: хорошее сцепление, резкий поворот. Термоядерный двигатель: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Lightning was designed for the Star League by Curtiss Industries as a hovercraft combat vehicle designed to take down slow BattleMechs and vehicles. Some commanders would combine several Lightnings into a temporary compact unit to crush the hostile line, using their maneuverability to break up formations. A interesting feature of the Lightning is a low wing mounted on the rear of the vehicle that increases the vehicle's stability at high speed. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 20 Left 80 20 Right 80 20 Rear 55 20 Total 335 80 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile
content.prevOriginal: Fast and versatile, the Light Tank is poorly suited to direct combat but has a variety of other uses. Intended as a scout or vanguard unit, the Light Tank is constantly on the move, probing ahead of the rest of the troops. Hover: Fast on open ground and water, slow in rough terrain, not very agile. content.original: The most common alternate configuration mounts an Ultra AC/20 in the turret, while its front is packed with two medium lasers and one ER Small Laser. It also mounts a C3 slave module. When the Federated Commonwealth was looking for OmniVehicle designs, StarCorps Industries quickly gathered a design team and released a prototype in record time. Officially it fulfilled all requirements, but unofficially StarCorps Industries had greased all the right palms. With every version able to deliver an awesome amount of firepower while being extremely fast for a heavy tank, the Manteuffel is a serious tank to consider. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 235 35 Left 200 35 Right 200 35 Rear 125 35 Turret 225 35 Total 985 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank Omni Vehicle
content.prevOriginal: Slower than the Medium Tank, but possessing heavier armor and fire power, the Heavy Tank is a fearsome combatant. content.original: The Manticore is one of the best-designed and most powerful heavy tanks ever created, built to combat BattleMechs in support of infantry formations. Although the Manticore mounts a variety of weapons to handle a variety of combat roles and ranges, and is heavily armored for a vehicle of its weight, it is not equipped to deal with the raw firepower of Assault weight vehicles such as the Demolisher or the Behemoth. Despite this, the popularity of the Manticore has remained high, even during the Succession Wars era with its use of an expensive and rare Fusion Engine. Originally developed by TechniCorp during the Reunification War, the destruction of the company's head office on Terra during the Amaris Coup spread the Manticore across the Inner Sphere as other manufacturers absorbed their facilities. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 230 30 Left 185 30 Right 185 30 Rear 130 30 Turret 210 30 Total 940 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.content: «Мантикора» - один из самых хорошо спроектированных и самых мощных тяжелых танков из когда-либо созданных, служит для борьбы с боевыми мехами в поддержку пехотных формирований. Несмотря на то, что Manticore оснащена разнообразным оружием для выполнения самых разных задач и хорошо бронирована для своего веса, она не оборудована для борьбы с грубой огневой мощью штурмовой техники, такой как Demolisher или Behemoth. Но в целом популярность Manticore оставалась высокой даже в эпоху Войн за Наследие, когда в ней использовался дорогой и редкий термоядерный двигатель. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: This variant of the Patton replaces the standard weaponry with a turret-mounted Ultra AC/10 and a pair of Medium Lasers to support it. For anti-infantry work, the Patton Ultra has three Machine Guns: One covers the rear while the other two cover the front of the tank. The Patton tank is a 65-ton armored combat vehicle, specializing in conventional armored warfare. Identical to its twin, the Rommel, in every way but armament and armor configuration, the Patton has primarily served with the Lyran Commonwealth and the Lyran Alliance. It is named after General George S. Patton, Jr., a legendary commander of armored and mechanized forces renowned for his exploits during World War II on Terra. Unlike the Rommel, which features a massive and powerful but short-ranged AC/20 as its main gun, the Patton generally mounts a main weapon suitable for engaging targets at medium to long range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 280 35 Left 235 35 Right 235 35 Rear 190 35 Turret 265 35 Total 1205 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: Debuting in 3062 this variant of the Pike carries three Rotary Autocannon/2s in the turret with four tons of ammunition. A Small Laser mounted on the front discourages infantry attacks. The Pike was created at the direction of Magestrix Kyalla Centrella of the Magistracy of Canopus during the later part of the Third Succession War. Her plan was to produce an inexpensive combat vehicle so the Great Houses would wear down their BattleMech armies through attrition, and the Pike would be the tool she envisioned for the task. However, sending vehicles to market in the Inner Sphere was to be more costly than anticipated. With the Great Houses' shrinking numbers of ships in their JumpShip fleets, the vehicle did not make the impact she had hoped it would. It became a favorite of ComStar's growing garrison forces for their HPG complexes. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 220 30 Left 150 30 Right 150 30 Rear 140 30 Turret 200 30 Total 860 150 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms

content.original: Built by the same company that made the Saracen and Scimitar, the Saladin was Scarborough's last medium hover tank. It is unlike its brothers in that the Saladin does not mount a turret, and its only weapon is a heavy, short-range AC/20. Since it's vastly different from the company's other hovercraft, buyers were quite skeptical about purchasing it; Scarborough had to offer incentives like free training and transportation. Soon it became as cheap as the Saracen and spread throughout the whole Inner Sphere. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 90 20 Left 45 20 Right 45 20 Rear 25 20 Total 205 80 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Replacing the LRM-10 with an MRM-20 is one of the few official variants of the Saracen. This version is mostly employed by the DCMS. It also removes the SRM-2 launchers and replaces them with a single Streak SRM-2 launcher. The Saracen is a well-designed hovercraft: it is fast and decently armored. It has endeared itself to its crews due to its reliability and ruggedness and forms the backbone of many striker units. The Saracen was developed towards the end of the Third Succession War by Scarborough Limited. Shortly afterward Scarborough created two other vehicles based on the Saracen, the Scimitar and the Saladin. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. content.original: This 3062 version is a field modification to the C3 variant of the Striker. This variant is found in the Draconis March, where it drops its C3 Slave Computer. The vehicle was given an additional ER Medium Laser, and the LRM ammunition was brought up to 16 rounds. The Striker Light Tank started out as a joint project venture between Valiant Systems and Wunderland Enterprises on the world of Johnsondale. They united in their efforts to create a joint company known as Valiant Vehicles, with the Striker being their first product. The low cost light fire support tank became a mainstay of the AFFS after its introduction in the first decade of the thirty-first century, and orders for the Striker soon outstripped the Valiant production line's capacity. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: A newer variant was more radical. This 'Heavy Gauss' variant replaced the turret mounted LRM-20 and Machine Guns with an Artemis IV assisted LRM-10 and an ER Medium Laser. Even more radical is the removal of the fixed missile rack and mounting a Heavy Gauss Rifle in the front of the tank. These also radically change the SturmFeur's mission from a fire support role to more of a close up brawler. Considering the SturmFeur's speed, it is unclear how well it would do in such a role. content.original: The Stygian is a speedy hovertank, topping out at 151 km/h. It uses this as its primary defense, as it only carries 5.5 tons of armor. The Stygian devotes exactly a quarter of its tonnage to an LRM-15 launcher and its attendant ammunition. Rather than provide static covering fire, as most support units do, the Stygian is able to keep up with the elements it supports and can swiftly move up and down almost any battlefield. Three separate ammo bins give it flexibility to carry different types of ammunition. In the unlikely event that another unit gets in under its gun, two Diverse Optics ER Medium Lasers provide backup. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 120 20 Left 95 20 Right 95 20 Rear 75 20 Turret 100 20 Total 485 100 Quirk: Nimble

content.original: This Svantovit Infantry Fighting Vehicle is a Jihad era variant, which has been nicknamed the Masada. While its armor protection remains the same as with the original, the rest of the vehicle has changed. The Svantovit's fusion engine is swapped out with a space saving XL Fusion Engine. This allows for the vehicle's Infantry Bay to be increased to 5 tons, allowing for Battle Armor travel in it. Mounted on the turret are a pair of AP Gauss Rifles and an ATM-9 Launcher . Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. content.original: The Tokugawa Heavy Tank is a wheeled heavy tank designed in the Draconis Combine. The vehicle saw extensive use during Operation Bulldog in 3059, where it safeguarded Combine worlds from reprisals from the Clan Smoke Jaguars. It was also used in offensive actions against Jaguar units on Outer Volta, and later saw action during the FedCom Civil War, as well as during the Jihad era. Developed as field refit, the LB-X 10 was replaced with a Thirty-tube Medium Range Missile Launcher with three tons of ammunition. Also added is a TAG designator for artillery support. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 30 Left 165 30 Right 165 30 Rear 130 30 Turret 180 30 Total 840 150 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

It has a five-ton infantry bay, enough to carry a full Point of Elementals. Since most front-line units have OmniMechs that the battle armor troopers can ride in on, the Tyr has mostly been distributed to second-line forces. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: Designed for the original Star League after the Reunification War as a BattleMech without legs, the Von Luckner is fully capable of blasting light 'Mechs to pieces. Named after Count Felix von Luckner of twentieth century Terra, the Von Luckner is one of the few tanks to use a fusion engine, as most vehicle-mounted reactors were stripped out for use in 'Mechs during the Succession Wars. Few of these vehicles remain in service, but they are very lethal, weighing more than most 'Mechs as well as boasting heavy armor and overwhelming firepower. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: A relatively common refit package for the Zhuckov upgrades its autocannons to Hyper Velocity versions. This improves it's performance in open terrain allows it to take on some fire support roles. However as always HVAC are temperamental. In 3030, Aldis Industries deployed the successful follow up to its venerable Demolisher design, the slightly lighter Zhukov. While it shares many of the parts and features of the design that inspired it, the Zhukov is smaller, better armored, and packs less weaponry than its predecessor. Its first major deployment was with the Wolf's Dragoons whereupon the Zhukov has since seen constant improvements and tweaks as suggested to Aldis Industries by the field units that use it. The Zhukov's strength is its relative simplicity. Two turret mounted SarLon MaxiCannon Autocannon/10s are more than adequate at providing sufficient firepower for the discriminating buyer while imitating its larger cousin the Demolisher. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Ajax Assault Tank is an Omni-capable combat vehicle that is the follow-up to GM's Challenger X MBT. The Ajax follows on the heels of the successful Manteuffel OmniVehicle. The Ajax is slow, only capable of attaining speeds up to 54 km/h. Since speed is not its defense, the designers gave the Ajax nineteen tons of armor. The room for all of this armor comes from the XL Engine the Ajax uses for power. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Daimyo HQ was a heavy theater command unit utilized by the Draconis Combine. The first Daimyo was fielded in 2796 at the beginning of the Succession Wars by Jinjiro Kurita, who used the vehicle during the Kentares Massacre. While the Coordinator attended executions in person, the Daimyo HQ's crew transmitted the data to ComStar representatives on the planet who then sent the data through the whole Inner Sphere. When Jinjiro discovered the treason, the whole crew was executed. Daimyo production ceased between the years 3027 and 3063 because the unit's communication system technology become a form of Lostech. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 245 25 Left 140 25 Right 140 25 Rear 90 25 Turret 155 25 Total 770 125 Quirk: Battle Computer B2000
content.prevOriginal: The Turhan was first built for the Terran Hegemony in 2530 by Dieron's Buhallin Military Products. The company, known for its wheeled vehicles, built the Turhan to answer the HAF's need for an urban assault vehicle to support its infantry in urban environments. The vehicle acted as an Armored Personnel Carrier, deploying troops from its large infantry transport bay. The vehicle is protected by seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, which ensured its cargo arrived at the designation intact. The Turhan's principal weaponry was its twin Large Lasers which were mounted in its turret. Mounted with the lasers were a pair of Machine Guns. Wheeled: Fast in open ground, slow in rough terrain. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Bailey armored car is a Gienah Automotive-produced civilian security vehicle first marketed in the mid-thirty-first century. The company exploited recovered Star League technology to enhance vehicle performance. The Bailey was designed to cope with battle armor-equipped infantry, which had steadily become more common. Aside for transporting high-value cargo, it can be used as makeshift armor infantry transport. The Bailey was designed to resist battle armor because of a daring raid that saw several robbers using Gray Death Standard battle armor to open a Knox armored car carrying payroll. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 80 15 Left 55 15 Right 55 15 Rear 55 15 Turret 50 15 Total 295 75 Quirk: Rugged

content.original: Developed in 3062 during the FedCom Civil War and produced by New Samarkand Metals, this version of the Behemoth removes all the standard weaponry. It carries a pair of Ultra AC/10s, a pair of MRM-10 launchers, and a pair of Artemis IV FCS enhanced SRM-6 launchers in the turret. To provide some additional long range firepower, it mounts a pair of LRM-5 launchers with Artemis guidance systems on the front of its hull. Introduced in 2952, the Behemoth was designed for increased firepower and heavy armor rather than speed or manoeuvrability. The design allowed the Behemoth to engage both distant and short-range targets, while allowing it to stand up to almost any type of unit possible. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 250 50 Left 190 50 Right 190 50 Rear 185 50 Turret 245 50 Total 1060 250 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Blizzard Hover Transport was designed by Kressly Warworks and was first produced in 3054. While the Blizzard was intended for use against the Clans, it gained notoriety in the Chaos March and its effectiveness was realized in the Capellan-St. Ives War. This variant dates to the late 3060s and is intended to be an escort for other Blizzards. It lacks the infantry bay and upgrades the armor protection utilizing Ferro-Fibrous technology. Instead of the LRM, the Black Blizzard mounts pairs of SRM-4s and Machine Guns in the turret. It also includes a Guardian ECM Suite to protect the unit from enemy electronics. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 75 15 Left 70 15 Right 70 15 Rear 65 15 Turret 65 15 Total 345 75 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles

content.original: Under-funded units unable to keep up with the expensive maintenance required to keep the Shrike launcher in optimum condition have been known to replace it with a cheaper SRM-4 launcher, using the extra space for a pair of machine guns and half-ton of ammunition. The Chaparral Missile Artillery was introduced by Grumman Industries in 2611. Designed to provide artillery support for the SLDF ground forces, the Chaparral frequently operated in places the larger Mobile Long Tom couldn't reach. The Chaparral was loved by the troops it supported because the shorter range of the Arrow IV meant that it was closer to the conflict and the missiles arrived more quickly. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: Despite the original being introduced in 2564 updated Condors are still in production as of the start of the 32nd Century. Substantial armor of at least six tons and various mid and long range weapon packages keep the Condor relevant. A heavy cavalry unit designed for rapid reaction to a shifting battle, the Condor was one of the few heavy hover tanks available at the time of it's introduction. This immense hovercraft is capable of a flank speed of 129 km/h and a cruising speed of 86 km/h, making it one of the fastest vehicles in its weight class. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. content.original: This unusual version of the Demolisher tank debuted during the FedCom Civil War. It replaces the AC/20's and some armor with a pair of Arrow IV missile launchers and seven tons of ammunition. For defense against close range attacks it mounts a pair of medium lasers. Tall, squat, and using four treads, the Demolisher has a well-earned, though sometimes exaggerated, reputation as one of the most deadly vehicles on the battlefield. Designed to counteract the increasing scarcity of 'Mechs during the Succession Wars, the Demolisher became popular, especially on worlds where BattleMechs were not available. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Donar Assault Helicopter is a versatile VTOL that is useful in a variety of roles, similar in concept to the Inner Sphere's Warrior. The helicopter is operated by a pilot and copilot/gunner seated in a tandem configuration, with a limited amount of redundancy in both positions should one or the other be knocked out. Three tons of Compound A2F ferro-fibrous armor keeps its safe from small arms fire, and its rotary blades will remain operational even when hit by 40mm caliber weapons. The well-armored hide also gives the Donar a good survival rate in low-altitude crashes. Like most VTOLs, the Donar is fast, capable of achieving up to 151 km/h. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 175 15 Left 100 15 Right 100 15 Rear 85 15 Total 475 75 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The Enyo Strike Tank is a combat vehicle produced by Clan Hell's Horses. Following the success of the XL Engine variant of the Mars, Khan Malavai Fletcher ordered his scientist caste to come up with a main battle tank that could take advantage of the speed a lightweight engine could bring. His successor, James Cobb, liked the idea and maintained the mandate for such a proof of concept. The result of the scientists' labor is the Enyo. It can hit speeds up to 97 km/h, which enables it to keep up with many Clan medium 'Mechs. Seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor protect the tank, allowing it to withstand some punishment, though speed is its best defense. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 170 30 Left 145 30 Right 145 30 Rear 125 30 Turret 145 30 Total 730 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Ferret Light Scout VTOL was first introduced to House Davion troops in 2901 and later adopted by House Marik, House Steiner and certain Periphery powers. The vehicle serves as an advanced scout with the ability to monitor enemy troop movements and radio in artillery strikes. Thanks to its speed, a single Ferret can patrol a front of up to twenty kilometers long, moving quickly from one area to the next. The vehicle is lightly armored and a hit from nearly any kind of 'Mech weaponry will destroy the Ferret. However, the Ferret's job is to avoid combat, and its agility allows it to remain outside the effective range of the enemy's weapons until reinforcements arrive. Besides reconnaissance and artillery spotting, the Ferret's cargo capacity also makes it suitable for transport and rescue operations. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 15/23 Hex: 450/690 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 40 5 Left 10 5 Right 10 5 Rear 10 5 Total 80 25 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: The first of two variants that date to the late 3060s, the ERSL is built on Dicallus and is popular with Taurian Concordat militia units based in cities. The simple modification replaces the medium laser with a pair of ER Small Lasers. The Gabriel's main role is reconnaissance and intelligence gathering, carrying information back to its parent unit quickly thanks to its high speed, and the vehicle mounts advanced communications and sensor equipment for longer-ranged satellite network transmissions. While the Gabriel only carries a single ton of armor, instead of standard or even ferro-fibrous plate, the designers used Ferro-Aluminum armor, normally reserved for aerospace fighters. The front, back, and turret carry the bulk of this meager protection, at the expense of the vehicle's sides. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 13/20 Hex: 390/600 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 55 5 Left 20 5 Right 20 5 Rear 10 5 Turret 25 5 Total 130 25 Quirk: Improved Communications

content.content: The first of two variants that date to the late 3060s, the ERSL is built on Dicallus and is popular with Taurian Concordat militia units based in cities. The simple modification replaces the medium laser with a pair of ER Small Lasers. The Gabriel's main role is reconnaissance and intelligence gathering, carrying information back to its parent unit quickly thanks to its high speed, and the vehicle mounts advanced communications and sensor equipment for longer-ranged satellite network transmissions. While the Gabriel only carries a single ton of armor, instead of standard or even ferro-fibrous plate, the designers used Ferro-Aluminum armor, normally reserved for aerospace fighters. The front, back, and turret carry the bulk of this meager protection, at the expense of the vehicle's sides. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 13/20 Hex: 390/600 Meters. Броня: Броня Структура: Структура Значения Б С Перед 55 5 Лево 20 5 Право 20 5 Зад 10 5 Turret 25 5 Итого 130 25 Особенность: Улучшенная связь

content.original: A light combat vehicle that first saw production in 2692 the Galleon proved to be an economical means of supporting infantry and BattleMechs. With a top speed faster than most 'Mechs, the Galleon was mobile but generally lacked protection, early models carrying only three and a half tons of armor. After the Exodus, these tracked vehicles mostly fell into the possession of the Draconis Combine and the Free Worlds League. The Galleon is often paired with the Harasser Missile Platform. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 225 15 Left 150 15 Right 150 15 Rear 100 15 Turret 100 15 Total 725 75 Quirk: Protected Mechanisms

content.original: An unusual and rare variant which is based on the Hunter (3055), it removes all weapons and mounts a close range heavy striking Ultra AC/20 with 3 tons of ammunition. This variant proved quite unpopular with its crews. The Hunter Light Support Tank is popular with planetary militias and second-line units. It was designed by Defiance Industries as a cheap, reliable and effective combat vehicle to provide covering fire support for combat units withdrawing from the front lines. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: Rarely seen in the field, the Jaguar II is a specialist variant of the Jaguar that debuted in the closing stages of the Civil War. Downgrading the engine to a 225 XL, allowed the Kali Yama engineers to mount a targeting computer, enhancing the accuracy of the Jaguars weapons. The lower speed is a controversial choice, with most Jaguar crews preferring the higher speed of the original model. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: The Lightning was designed for the Star League by Curtiss Industries as a hovercraft combat vehicle designed to take down slow BattleMechs and vehicles. Some commanders would combine several Lightnings into a temporary compact unit to crush the hostile line, using their maneuverability to break up formations. A interesting feature of the Lightning is a low wing mounted on the rear of the vehicle that increases the vehicle's stability at high speed. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: The most common alternate configuration mounts an Ultra AC/20 in the turret, while its front is packed with two medium lasers and one ER Small Laser. It also mounts a C3 slave module. When the Federated Commonwealth was looking for OmniVehicle designs, StarCorps Industries quickly gathered a design team and released a prototype in record time. Officially it fulfilled all requirements, but unofficially StarCorps Industries had greased all the right palms. With every version able to deliver an awesome amount of firepower while being extremely fast for a heavy tank, the Manteuffel is a serious tank to consider. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 235 35 Left 200 35 Right 200 35 Rear 125 35 Turret 225 35 Total 985 175 Quirk: Main Battle Tank Omni Vehicle

content.original: The Manticore is one of the best-designed and most powerful heavy tanks ever created, built to combat BattleMechs in support of infantry formations. Although the Manticore mounts a variety of weapons to handle a variety of combat roles and ranges, and is heavily armored for a vehicle of its weight, it is not equipped to deal with the raw firepower of Assault weight vehicles such as the Demolisher or the Behemoth. Despite this, the popularity of the Manticore has remained high, even during the Succession Wars era with its use of an expensive and rare Fusion Engine. Originally developed by TechniCorp during the Reunification War, the destruction of the company's head office on Terra during the Amaris Coup spread the Manticore across the Inner Sphere as other manufacturers absorbed their facilities. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 230 30 Left 185 30 Right 185 30 Rear 130 30 Turret 210 30 Total 940 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.content: «Мантикора» - один из самых хорошо спроектированных и самых мощных тяжелых танков из когда-либо созданных, служит для борьбы с боевыми мехами в поддержку пехотных формирований. Несмотря на то, что Manticore оснащена разнообразным оружием для выполнения самых разных задач и хорошо бронирована для своего веса, она не оборудована для борьбы с грубой огневой мощью штурмовой техники, такой как Demolisher или Behemoth. Но в целом популярность Manticore оставалась высокой даже в эпоху Войн за Наследие, когда в ней использовался дорогой и редкий термоядерный двигатель. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.prevOriginal: The Manticore is one of the best-designed and most powerful heavy tanks ever created, built to combat BattleMechs in support of infantry formations. Although the Manticore mounts a variety of weapons to handle a variety of combat roles and ranges, and is heavily armored for a vehicle of its weight, it is not equipped to deal with the raw firepower of Assault weight vehicles such as the Demolisher or the Behemoth. Despite this, the popularity of the Manticore has remained high, even during the Succession Wars era with its use of an expensive and rare Fusion Engine. Originally developed by TechniCorp during the Reunification War, the destruction of the company's head office on Terra during the Amaris Coup spread the Manticore across the Inner Sphere as other manufacturers absorbed their facilities. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 240 30 Left 190 30 Right 190 30 Rear 130 30 Turret 212 30 Total 962 150
content.content: «Мантикора» - один из самых хорошо спроектированных и самых мощных тяжелых танков из когда-либо созданных, служит для борьбы с боевыми мехами в поддержку пехотных формирований. Несмотря на то, что Manticore оснащена разнообразным оружием для выполнения самых разных задач и хорошо бронирована для своего веса, она не оборудована для борьбы с грубой огневой мощью штурмовой техники, такой как Demolisher или Behemoth. Но в целом популярность Manticore оставалась высокой даже в эпоху Войн за Наследие, когда в ней использовался дорогой и редкий термоядерный двигатель. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: This variant of the Patton replaces the standard weaponry with a turret-mounted Ultra AC/10 and a pair of Medium Lasers to support it. For anti-infantry work, the Patton Ultra has three Machine Guns: One covers the rear while the other two cover the front of the tank. The Patton tank is a 65-ton armored combat vehicle, specializing in conventional armored warfare. Identical to its twin, the Rommel, in every way but armament and armor configuration, the Patton has primarily served with the Lyran Commonwealth and the Lyran Alliance. It is named after General George S. Patton, Jr., a legendary commander of armored and mechanized forces renowned for his exploits during World War II on Terra. Unlike the Rommel, which features a massive and powerful but short-ranged AC/20 as its main gun, the Patton generally mounts a main weapon suitable for engaging targets at medium to long range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: Debuting in 3062 this variant of the Pike carries three Rotary Autocannon/2s in the turret with four tons of ammunition. A Small Laser mounted on the front discourages infantry attacks. The Pike was created at the direction of Magestrix Kyalla Centrella of the Magistracy of Canopus during the later part of the Third Succession War. Her plan was to produce an inexpensive combat vehicle so the Great Houses would wear down their BattleMech armies through attrition, and the Pike would be the tool she envisioned for the task. However, sending vehicles to market in the Inner Sphere was to be more costly than anticipated. With the Great Houses' shrinking numbers of ships in their JumpShip fleets, the vehicle did not make the impact she had hoped it would. It became a favorite of ComStar's growing garrison forces for their HPG complexes. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: Built by the same company that made the Saracen and Scimitar, the Saladin was Scarborough's last medium hover tank. It is unlike its brothers in that the Saladin does not mount a turret, and its only weapon is a heavy, short-range AC/20. Since it's vastly different from the company's other hovercraft, buyers were quite skeptical about purchasing it; Scarborough had to offer incentives like free training and transportation. Soon it became as cheap as the Saracen and spread throughout the whole Inner Sphere. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. content.original: Replacing the LRM-10 with an MRM-20 is one of the few official variants of the Saracen. This version is mostly employed by the DCMS. It also removes the SRM-2 launchers and replaces them with a single Streak SRM-2 launcher. The Saracen is a well-designed hovercraft: it is fast and decently armored. It has endeared itself to its crews due to its reliability and ruggedness and forms the backbone of many striker units. The Saracen was developed towards the end of the Third Succession War by Scarborough Limited. Shortly afterward Scarborough created two other vehicles based on the Saracen, the Scimitar and the Saladin. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. content.original: This 3062 version is a field modification to the C3 variant of the Striker. This variant is found in the Draconis March, where it drops its C3 Slave Computer. The vehicle was given an additional ER Medium Laser, and the LRM ammunition was brought up to 16 rounds. The Striker Light Tank started out as a joint project venture between Valiant Systems and Wunderland Enterprises on the world of Johnsondale. They united in their efforts to create a joint company known as Valiant Vehicles, with the Striker being their first product. The low cost light fire support tank became a mainstay of the AFFS after its introduction in the first decade of the thirty-first century, and orders for the Striker soon outstripped the Valiant production line's capacity. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. content.original: A newer variant was more radical. This 'Heavy Gauss' variant replaced the turret mounted LRM-20 and Machine Guns with an Artemis IV assisted LRM-10 and an ER Medium Laser. Even more radical is the removal of the fixed missile rack and mounting a Heavy Gauss Rifle in the front of the tank. These also radically change the SturmFeur's mission from a fire support role to more of a close up brawler. Considering the SturmFeur's speed, it is unclear how well it would do in such a role.
