content.original: The Stygian is a speedy hovertank, topping out at 151 km/h. It uses this as its primary defense, as it only carries 5.5 tons of armor. The Stygian devotes exactly a quarter of its tonnage to an LRM-15 launcher and its attendant ammunition. Rather than provide static covering fire, as most support units do, the Stygian is able to keep up with the elements it supports and can swiftly move up and down almost any battlefield. Three separate ammo bins give it flexibility to carry different types of ammunition. In the unlikely event that another unit gets in under its gun, two Diverse Optics ER Medium Lasers provide backup. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. content.original: This Svantovit Infantry Fighting Vehicle is a Jihad era variant, which has been nicknamed the Masada. While its armor protection remains the same as with the original, the rest of the vehicle has changed. The Svantovit's fusion engine is swapped out with a space saving XL Fusion Engine. This allows for the vehicle's Infantry Bay to be increased to 5 tons, allowing for Battle Armor travel in it. Mounted on the turret are a pair of AP Gauss Rifles and an ATM-9 Launcher . Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 11/17 Hex: 330/510 Meters. content.original: The Tokugawa Heavy Tank is a wheeled heavy tank designed in the Draconis Combine. The vehicle saw extensive use during Operation Bulldog in 3059, where it safeguarded Combine worlds from reprisals from the Clan Smoke Jaguars. It was also used in offensive actions against Jaguar units on Outer Volta, and later saw action during the FedCom Civil War, as well as during the Jihad era. Developed as field refit, the LB-X 10 was replaced with a Thirty-tube Medium Range Missile Launcher with three tons of ammunition. Also added is a TAG designator for artillery support. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Since most front-line units have OmniMechs that the battle armor troopers can ride in on, the Tyr has mostly been distributed to second-line forces. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: Designed for the original Star League after the Reunification War as a BattleMech without legs, the Von Luckner is fully capable of blasting light 'Mechs to pieces. Named after Count Felix von Luckner of twentieth century Terra, the Von Luckner is one of the few tanks to use a fusion engine, as most vehicle-mounted reactors were stripped out for use in 'Mechs during the Succession Wars. Few of these vehicles remain in service, but they are very lethal, weighing more than most 'Mechs as well as boasting heavy armor and overwhelming firepower. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.content: Designed for the original Star League after the Reunification War as a BattleMech without legs, the Von Luckner is fully capable of blasting light 'Mechs to pieces. Named after Count Felix von Luckner of twentieth century Terra, the Von Luckner is one of the few tanks to use a fusion engine, as most vehicle-mounted reactors were stripped out for use in 'Mechs during the Succession Wars. Few of these vehicles remain in service, but they are very lethal, weighing more than most 'Mechs as well as boasting heavy armor and overwhelming firepower. content.original: The Yellow Jacket was built around the Poland Model C Gauss rifle. Subsequent version mounted other system, but it remained centered around as single heavy weapon. Though not as fast as most VTOLs, the Yellow Jacket still has greater speed than most BattleMechs and OmniMechs. The long range weapons, respectable speed and relatively heavy armor keep the vehicle safer than many of it's peers. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. content.original: A relatively common refit package for the Zhuckov upgrades its autocannons to Hyper Velocity versions. This improves it's performance in open terrain allows it to take on some fire support roles. However as always HVAC are temperamental. In 3030, Aldis Industries deployed the successful follow up to its venerable Demolisher design, the slightly lighter Zhukov. While it shares many of the parts and features of the design that inspired it, the Zhukov is smaller, better armored, and packs less weaponry than its predecessor. Its first major deployment was with the Wolf's Dragoons whereupon the Zhukov has since seen constant improvements and tweaks as suggested to Aldis Industries by the field units that use it. The Zhukov's strength is its relative simplicity. Two turret mounted SarLon MaxiCannon Autocannon/10s are more than adequate at providing sufficient firepower for the discriminating buyer while imitating its larger cousin the Demolisher. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 240 40 Left 160 40 Right 160 40 Rear 120 40 Turret 230 40 Total 910 200 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: The Ares Medium Tank (ATM) is designed to stand off and take down its enemies at long range. Its top speed of 86 km/h is fast for a fire support vehicle, so it is often paired with APC to support infantry. Four and a half tons of armor protect the vehicle and its crew; this somewhat meager amount encourages Ares crews to stay out of range of most return fire. The main weapon is an ER Large Laser mounted in the turret. Mounted in the front is an ATM-12. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 20 Left 90 20 Right 90 20 Rear 70 20 Turret 100 20 Total 465 100 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: Introduced in 3054, the Cavalry Attack Helicopter was one of a number of VTOLs developed to fight the Clans by Michaelson Heavy Industries. Suited to hit-and-run engagements rather than front-line combat situations the Cavalry gained a reputation for flawless service when used correctly. It has since seen service in former FedCom States and minor-nobles among the Chaos March. While capable of speeds up to 162 km/h, the Cavalry doesn't rely on this alone for protection and has 3.5 tons armor. The craft can handle a direct hit from a Clan-tech ER PPC on the nose and keep flying. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 90 15 Right 90 15 Rear 65 15 Total 360 75 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: The Centipede Scout Car was produced by Gienah Combat Vehicles & Red Devil Industries in 3053. The vehicle was originally intended for reconnaissance ahead of its command unit to spot hidden units, but the Centipede SRM variant is a battlefield modification created during the FedCom Civil War in 3062 specifically altered to be utilized as a quick striker in hit and run attacks. It removes all original equipment of the standard model in favor of six SRM-2 missile launchers with a single ton of ammunition to significantly boost firepower at the cost of losing its advanced sensors and scouting capabilities. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 80 10 Left 80 10 Right 80 10 Rear 80 10 Total 320 40 Quirk: Nimble

content.original: Designed as an inexpensive alternative to Mechs, the 45 ton Glaive Medium Tank entered service with the Skye Rangers in 3066. Powered by a 205 rated Fusion Engine, the Glaive can reach a top speed of 86 kph and is protected by 5 and a half tons of armour. An ER Large Laser and an Artemis IV enhanced LRM-15 are supplemented by a pair of Machine Guns for close range combat. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 140 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 95 25 Total 515 125 Quirk: Variable Range Targeting

content.original: The Hephaestus Scout Tank is an OmniVehicle produced exclusively by Clan Hell's Horses. All variants of the Hephaestus incorporate a sizable infantry bay as well as an Active Probe to locate hidden units. A support variant introduced in 3064, the Hephaestus A mounts an LRM-15 in its turret along with an Artemis IV Fire Control System. A single ton of ammunition does not allow for a high rate of fire for an extended period of time. Supplementing the missile launcher is a single ER Small Laser. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. content.original: Rasasa means 'Bullet' in Arabic. The Ifrit VTOL Strike Craft was designed to intercept and delay armored advances. Reactive armor, a Jet Booster and redundant AMS increase it's chances of getting close enough to deploy it's large payload of mines and Inferno. The Ifrit Rasasa variant swaps the base model's SRM for a gauss cannon and medium lasers. The inferno and FASCAM bombs are generally traded for guided missiles for tank hunting. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. Armor: Reactive Plating Structure: Structure Values A S Front 155 28 Left 115 28 Right 115 28 Rear 95 28 Total 500 140 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: Saakh means 'Thunderbolt' in Arabic. The Ifrit VTOL Strike Craft was designed to intercept and delay armored advances. Reactive armor, a Jet Booster and redundant AMS increase it's chances of getting close enough to deploy it's large payload of mines and Inferno. The Ifrit Saakh variant swaps the base model's SRM for a the ability to deliver a pinpoint strike with a hard hitting TBM, the traditional inferno bombs and mines with 150 AA rockets to clear the skies, with a pair of FAE bombs to strike ground targets of opportunity. The Saakh is often deployed to protect its ground-strike focused siblings. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. content.original: The Karnov UR Transport is a heavy lift VTOL which has been in service for hundreds of years. The tilt-rotor design is one of the fastest of its type in use. A reliable and hardy machine, all of the Successor State armed forces and many mercenary units employ Karnovs for supply and logistics missions. Many commercial firms also use the machine for local transportation of cargo in its sizable 6-ton bay or as a flying crane. Mounting a pair of ER Medium Lasers and two tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor, this Karnov variant can deploy battle armored infantry directly from its twelve ton cargo bay. To provide electronic protection a Guardian ECM Suite is mounted in the nose. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. content.original: The Main Gauche Light Support Tank is a fire support companion to Brooks Incorporated's Galleon. Though slower, topping out at only 64 km/h, five tons of armor protect it. The Main Gauche was actually submitted to the Free Worlds League Military because that organization was looking for a tank with long range capability. It finally reached full production in 3064. The main gun of the Main Gauche is an Imperator Type II Light Gauss Rifle, a weapon that has an incredible range. The single magazine carries a ton of ammunition. In order to mount this, however, the tank forgoes speed, armor, a turret, and close-range weaponry. Its only backup is a pair of Voelkers Machine Guns, which are only a credible threat to unarmored infantry. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 145 15 Left 95 15 Right 95 15 Rear 65 15 Total 400 60 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: The Main Gauche Light Support Tank is a fire support companion to Brooks Incorporated's Galleon. Though slower, topping out at only 64 km/h, five tons of armor protect it. The Main Gauche was actually submitted to the Free Worlds League Military because that organization was looking for a tank with long range capability. It finally reached full production in 3064. This variant introduced in 3066 removes the Machine Guns to add a C3 Slave Unit and an ER Small Laser. While this lessens short-range damage potential, it makes the Light Gauss Rifle much more accurate if another unit in its C3 network is close to the Main Gauche's target. This makes it even more advantageous for the light tank to stay at extreme range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: The Morningstar City Command Vehicle is designed to coordinate battles that take place within urban centers. The Morningstar is built around a C3 computer that can coordinate friendly units. Four tons of cargo space let's it ferry infantry into the battle. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: The Musketeer hover tank is a combat vehicle designed to deliver concentrated firepower quickly and cheaply. The hovertank is as difficult to kill as a hover vehicle can be, with seven tons of ferro-fibrous armor protecting it, and CASE protecting its four-person crew from internal explosions. An ICE is inexpensive and can still maintain speeds up to 119 km/h. The Musketeer was created to deliver a Mydron Tornado RAC/5 to the field. Three tons of ammunition give the Musketeer's crew the ability to maintain sustained fire. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 180 25 Left 135 25 Right 135 25 Rear 100 25 Turret 140 25 Total 690 125 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics

content.original: First appearing in 3056, the Palisade Defense Tank is a 60 ton defensive tank found throughout the wealthier parts of the Periphery. Based on an older tank design dating back to the Succession Wars, the Palisade is designed as a multi role tank capable of engaging Mechs or Vehicles. Capable of speeds of 60 kph, the Palisade (MRM) is powered by a 240 rated Fuel Cell and carries 12 tons of armour. The main gun is an LB-10X, with a MRM-20 supporting this at shorter ranges. An MG provides some limited anti infantry capabilities. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 260 30 Left 185 30 Right 185 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 195 30 Total 975 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: Mounting a pair each of Rotary AC/5s and LB 2-X ACs, the 3067 RAC variant of the Partisan is able to pump out a significant amount of gunfire in a short amount of time. It also adds another ton of armor for increase durability. This 3069 variant also uses an XL engine, but mounts four Rotary AC/2s, a Targeting Computer, and a C3 slave unit to trade targeting data. The armor protection has been increased by nearly 45% over the base XL variant. Kallon Industries, famous for designing some of the most popular anti-aircraft 'Mechs in the Inner Sphere, designed the Partisan to bring those same capabilities onto a cheaper, more easily produced vehicle. Dedicated to destroying aircraft, its targeting system can track up to 200 targets at once, compute the optimal target, and link to the targeting systems of other Partisans in the unit. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 40 Left 160 40 Right 160 40 Rear 130 40 Turret 200 40 Total 850 200 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

It also adds another ton of armor for increase durability. This 3069 variant also uses an XL engine, but mounts four Rotary AC/2s, a Targeting Computer, and a C3 slave unit to trade targeting data. The armor protection has been increased by nearly 45% over the base XL variant. Kallon Industries, famous for designing some of the most popular anti-aircraft 'Mechs in the Inner Sphere, designed the Partisan to bring those same capabilities onto a cheaper, more easily produced vehicle. Dedicated to destroying aircraft, its targeting system can track up to 200 targets at once, compute the optimal target, and link to the targeting systems of other Partisans in the unit. Термоядерный: дорогой двигатель, работающий в вакууме. Передвижение: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: Produced for the LAAF as a battle armor platoon carrier, even with an XL engine the extra weight required limits the craft to a single Small Pulse Laser and one ton of heavy ferro-fibrous armor. The Ripper, built from proven components for maximum reliability, uses a fusion engine to give the vehicle a significant range, as well as a high top speed, so much that the infantry compartment is equipped with special acceleration couches to handle the strain of a high speed combat insertion. content.original: Derided by critics and loved by it’s crews, the 25 ton Venator is a VTOL designed to hunt tanks. Slower then other contemporary VTOL’s, the low cost Venator makes up for it’s slower speed by mounting an AC/10 or a large missile launcher, giving it exceptionally heavy fire power for it’s small size. Produced by a handful of companies in the Periphery, the Venator is a common sight on the battlefields of the Periphery where it is often fielded in large quantities. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 65 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 40 15 Total 220 75 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original: The -S3-DC subvariant of the -S3 replaces the two Small Lasers and two heatsinks with a Command Cockpit. The variant quickly became the main command Atlas within the Lyran forces.
content.prevOriginal: The S3 Atlas is a rearmament of the S2 version introduced in 3062. The Heavy Gauss Rifle is reduced to a standard model Gauss Rifle with sixteen shots while each arm contains a PPC and a Small Laser. An additional small laser is mounted in the head. For extra defense, an AMS is installed on the left arm. The Artemis IV-enhanced LRM-15 and Guardian ECM Suite of the S2 model remain.
content.content: S3-DC - вариант модели S3 - заменяет два малых лазера и два радиатора командирской кабиной. Этот вариант быстро стал основным командирским атласом в лиранских войсках.

content.original:
A complete upgrade of the original design, the 01B variant replaces the XL engine with a Light Fusion Engine. To make up for the weight lost to the engine, the entire weapons arsenal has been re-evaluated and the 'Mech carries a new weapons compliment. The primary long-range weapons are a pair of LRM-5 launchers. For intermediate ranges, the 01B model carries an Ultra Autocannon/10 and a PPC providing it with a powerful punch. Finally, for close range combat, the 'Mech has four Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-2 launcher. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: Katherine Steiner-Davion decided during her reign over the Lyran Alliance that she wanted a four legged BattleMech that would evoke fear in its enemies in a similar vein to the classic Atlas and Banshee designs. To do this, the Barghest is built on an Earthwerk GRF Quad chassis that supports a Magna 350 XL engine that saves weight and allows the 'Mech to carry a heavy weapons payload. The Barghest is protected by thirteen tons of Durallex Heavy armor that protects it from all but the heaviest enemy fire. To handle the 'Mech's heat buildup from its weapons, the Barghest has ten double heat sinks.

content.original: The Basilisk ProtoMech was designed and built by Clan Cloud Cobra to support their Elemental and OmniMech forces. Unlike most second generation Protos, the Basilisk has a relatively low top speed. The Basilisk mounts a 'Mech sized ER Medium Laser. Paired with the laser is a three tube LRM launcher used to soften up targets as the Basilisk unit closes. The only problem with this is the severely limited ammunition supply. Quirk: Heavy ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9

content.original: The 4S variant of the BattleMaster is a new look at an old 'Mech. Introduced by Red Devil Industries in cooperation with J.B. BattleMechs in 3062, the 4S is built on a StarFrame Heavy chassis, powered by a 340 VOX Light Fusion Engine, and armored with thirteen and a half tons of ArcShield Maxi X Ferro-fibrous armor. The long-range firepower comes from a Zeus Slingshot Gauss rifle in the right arm, fed by three tons of reloads in the right torso. The 'Mech also carries four RAMTech 1500Z ER medium lasers and two Defiance B3M medium lasers split between the side torso for intermediate ranges, as well as a TharHes Maxi SRM-6 with two tons of reloads and an Artemis IV fire control system in the left torso. For anti-infantry combat, this BattleMaster carries two Defiance P5S Small Pulse Lasers in the left arm and CASE to protect its munitions. The electronics were replaced by an O/P 3000 COMSET and a Cyclops Multi-Tasker 10 T&T system. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster is one of the best known 'Mechs in existence. Originally designed to be the largest and most powerful 'Mech for the Star League armies in the 27th century, the sheer size of the BattleMaster, combined with the cost and resources needed to build one, meant the 'Mech can only be manufactured on a few planets. Still, those lucky enough to pilot a BattleMaster can attest to some of the stories surrounding the 'Mech. With good reliability, firepower and armoring, the BattleMaster is equally adept anchoring an assault lance or serving as a command vehicle.

content.original: The 5M was an upgrade that reflected the weapon trends in the Free Worlds League prior to the Jihad. Based on examples captured from Kristen's Krushers and using the BLR-3M as a base, the 'Mech was armed with a Light Gauss Rifle, giving it a range exceeding seven hundred meters. The Light Gauss is backed up by an ER Large Laser for long-range engagements while for close ranges, the 5M carries six ER medium lasers, two of which are rear facing. These models were first fielded in 3067. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The CM (C3 Master) variant of the BattleMaster was built by the Kuritans in 3064 to command a C3 company. A smaller engine means the 'Mech's speed has been reduced to 54 km/h in order to allow it to carry a C3 master computer. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC, two ER medium lasers, and a Shigunga MRM 30. It is armored with sixteen tons of armor to better protect the valuable computers that allow it to coordinate an entire company. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The Battle Cobra makes use of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous technologies, but uses a standard Fusion Engine for increased durability. The primary weapon of the C configuration is an ATM 9, but it lack sufficient ammunition storage to make full use of the ATM technology. It is backed up by pulse lasers; two mediums and a small. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Battle Cobra was already in the prototype stages when Clan Steel Viper introduced their first OmniMech, the Crossbow. The Battle Cobra prototypes were quickly redesigned to allow similar arm-mounted Omni-Pods, debuting only a few years later. Like the Crossbow, the Battle Cobra does not mount fixed jump jets and cannot mount them in their arms - therefore, early Battle Cobras would not be jump-capable.

content.original:
Constructed using IS-grade Endo-Steel and clad in seven tons of Inner Sphere quality Ferro-Fibrous armor, the BTL-C-2O Battle Cobra mounts a lighter 200 rated standard fusion engine. While reducing its speed by 20 kph, the extra weight was required to carry heavier IS grade weapons as well as mount a fixed Improved C3 Computer in its center torso. The Prime is based on its Clan counterpart, carrying an IS-grade Large Pulse Laser in each arm as well as an extra double heat sink. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Obtaining a large number of mostly operational Battle Cobras in the aftermath of brutal conflict in the Devil's Bath during the Battle of Tukayyid, ComStar selected the Battle Cobra as the focus of their efforts to reverse-engineer and develop their own OmniMech.

content.original:
Constructed using IS-grade Endo-Steel and clad in seven tons of Inner Sphere quality Ferro-Fibrous armor, the BTL-C-2O Battle Cobra mounts a lighter 200 rated standard fusion engine. While reducing its speed by 20 kph, the extra weight was required to carry heavier IS grade weapons as well as mount a fixed Improved C3 Computer in its center torso. An electronic warfare config, the BTL-C-2OA carries a TAG and a Guardian ECM Suite in its right arm and a Beagle Active Probe in its left. For protection a trio of IS-grade Medium and a single Small Pulse Lasers are mounted in its left arm and three standard Medium Lasers in its right, also fitted with an additional double heat sink Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

content.content: Obtaining a large number of mostly operational Battle Cobras in the aftermath of brutal conflict in the Devil's Bath during the Battle of Tukayyid, ComStar selected the Battle Cobra as the focus of their efforts to reverse-engineer and develop their own OmniMech.

content.original:
Constructed using IS-grade Endo-Steel and clad in seven tons of Inner Sphere quality Ferro-Fibrous armor, the BTL-C-2O Battle Cobra mounts a lighter 200 rated standard fusion engine. While reducing its speed by 20 kph, the extra weight was required to carry heavier IS grade weapons as well as mount a fixed Improved C3 Computer in its center torso. An Improved Narc Missile Beacon spotter, the BTL-C-2OC mount an iNARC launcher in each arm. While carrying no other weapons of any kind, five tons of reloads allows it to carry every conceivable form of iNARC ammo. An additional heat sink rounds out the config. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
The U loadout combines three ER PPC with two Medium Pulse Lasers and four ER Medium Lasers, all linked through a large six ton targeting computer. Due to its full energy loadout a total of 24 double heat sinks can just barely keep up with the cooling needed, assuming some constraint is kept from firing repeated alpha strikes. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Blue Flame's primary armament is two ER Large Lasers that allow the 'Mech to engage the enemy at long ranges. It also has three Streak SRM-2 launchers for close range combat. The 'Mech is built around a Endo Steel chassis that cradles a 225 Light Fusion engine that gives the 'Mech a top speed of 86.4 km/h. The Blue Flame carries an impressive eleven tons of armor and has ten double heat sinks. To allow the 'Mech to share targeting data with friendly units, it is equipped with an improved C3 computer that allows it to exchange information with other C3i equipped units Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The Blue Flame began production after the Word of Blake took possession of Terra. The same factory that had produced the Shootist was upgraded to produce four legged BattleMechs. The Blue Flame is an extremely stable platform due to its quadrupedal configuration. In the later years of the Jihad, an engineer who had help build the Mech stole the design specs and later created the Thunder Fox.

content.original: The Cecerops ProtoMech was designed and built by Clan Blood Spirit using materials acquired from Clan Snow Raven. Though not as heavily armored as some other ProtoMechs, the design's high speed prevents most opponents from getting a target lock. The Cecerops is armed with a single ER Micro Laser. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

content.original: One of the best first generation ProtoMechs, the Centaur combines high speed, decent armor, and a varied weapons mix. These features make it a flexible combatant, able to keep up with scout 'Mechs while supporting them. Developed during the 3060s, this variant utilizes then-newly developed Heavy Laser technology. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
Clan Nova Cat’s Conjurer program in the 3060s saw refits and various new builds at times only loosely based on the original. Some of them, like the Conjurer 6, had back-canted legs and weapon pod arms reliant on energy weapons. These served as foundation to the Hellcat, and inspired the Avalanche's upgrade to the Wendigo seventy years later on Avon. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Conjurer  is a fast, inexpensive medium BattleMech that excels at medium to short range. As befitting its status as a second-line 'Mech, the Conjurer uses a standard engine, though it is constructed on an Endo Steel chassis and uses eight and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Its jump jets enable it to leap up to 180 meters at a time. Armed with a Large Pulse Laser, the Conjurer can fall back on paired ER Medium Lasers and Streak SRM-2s for closer range combat. Ten double heat sinks are able to keep heat under control.

content.original: Khan Marthe Pryde decided to upgrade the 'Mechs her Clan fielded. Rather than waste precious resources designing a new OmniMech from the ground up, she instructed her scientists to improve upon existing designs. The design the scientists chose to modify was the Adder. Though the two 'Mechs are visually similar and share the same weight, the Cougar is slower and better armed.

content.original: Utilizing some of the newest technology available in the Capellan Confederation, the 7L was built by Tao 'Mechworks in 3067. It used Stealth Armor, making it harder to target. The 'Mech also used double heat sinks and is armed with two LRM-15 launchers, two Streak SRM-4 launchers, and two ER Medium Lasers. Finally, the 'Mech carried a Guardian ECM Suite to allow its Stealth Armor to work. In order to make room, the top speed was lowered to 53 km/h by replacing the engine with a Nissan Fusion 195, though jump jets offset that through increased maneuverability. Despite its Liao origins, half of the first production run was sold to the Word of Blake. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09
content.prevOriginal: Utilizing some of the newest technology available in the Capellan Confederation, the 7L was built by Tao 'Mechworks in 3067. It used Stealth Armor, making it harder to target. The 'Mech also used double heat sinks and is armed with two LRM-15 launchers, two Streak SRM-4 launchers, and two ER Medium Lasers. Finally, the 'Mech carried a Guardian ECM Suite to allow its Stealth Armor to work. In order to make room, the top speed was lowered to 53 km/h by replacing the engine with a Nissan Fusion 195, though jump jets offset that through increased maneuverability. Despite its Liao origins, half of the first production run was sold to the Word of Blake. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.prevOriginal: A stealthy Crusader with Jump Jets, be prepared for pain delievered from above with little warning. And still it keeps a respectable level of weaponry. Impressive.

content.original: Created in 3066 with the mindset of 'bigger is better', the -8S Crusader was built around an Endo Steel chassis and powered by an XL Engine. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Delphyne was developed by Clan Blood Spirit and Clan Fire Mandrill. Basing the design on the lessons learned from producing the Minotaur, the Delphyne is one of the most effective heavy ProtoMechs. Carrying a 'Mech sized Medium Pulse Laser, the Delphyne packs a significant punch when used against light and medium 'Mechs, and a Point of them can threaten a heavy 'Mech. Quirk: Heavy ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
A field refit turned factory variant of the Enforcer III, the 6T model removes the Autocannon, ER Large Laser and ER Small Laser in favor of a powerful Poland Gauss Rifle for sniping and an Diverse Optics ER Medium Laser for close combat. The weapons on the Enforcer III are all linked to an advanced Targeting Computer that gives the 6T model incredible accuracy. Spare weight and space allows the factory built 6T to mount a hand on the left arm as well as an extra half ton of armor. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

A comparatively new variant that appeared with the Dragoons shortly before the fighting on Outreach, the 4D saves weight through the use of a Light Engine, Endo Steel, and Ferro-Fibrous armor. Like the 4C, this variant adds an Artemis IV FCS to the LRM-5. The D, however, upgrades the lasers to ER Medium Lasers. Due to space constraints, the 4D uses twelve single heat sinks that are sorely taxed. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The FS9-C is an upgrade of the Firestarter manufactured by Coventry Metal Works for the Periphery starting in 3064. The armor has been upgraded to ferro-fibrous and the 'Mech carries two flamers, two medium lasers, two RL-15s, and four RL-10s, giving it an incredible one-shot kill capability against heavier 'Mechs. The already overwhelming number of Firestarters in the near Periphery led to the failure of this variant. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: An 80 ton Quad Mech, the Goliath entered production in 2652. Partially based on data from the earlier Scorpion Quad Mech, the Goliath carries a heavier payload of weapons and armour, intended to boost it’s effectiveness on the battlefield. Powered by a 320 rated Fusion Core, the Goliath GOL-1H is armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-10’s. A pair of Machine Guns provide closer ranged firepower.

content.original: The 5D uses some of the newest technology available to the Federated Suns in 3067. The 'Mech is built based on the rugged older 1H chassis and standard engine. The 'Mech carries as its primary weapon a Rotary Autocannon/5. This is backed up by four ER Medium Lasers and two Machine Guns. The lasers and autocannon are all linked to an advanced Targeting Computer which gives the Goliath deadly accuracy at long ranges. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The 7K variant first built in 3063 uses an Endo Steel chassis to free up weight and carries an XL Engine for power, which is linked to a MASC system. This allows the Grand Dragon to move at speeds of up to 129.6 km/h in short bursts. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC as its primary weapon. For support, the 'Mech carries an MRM-10 as its secondary weapon. The 'Mech also carries three ER Medium Lasers as close combat weapons, all of which are carried in the left arm to allow for the greatest range of fire. Finally, the 'Mech has a C3 slave unit that allows it to share targeting information with friendly units. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Grand Dragon is the successful follow-up to the Dragon BattleMech. Just like the Dragon, the Grand Dragon quickly became a favorite in the DCMS, with nearly every line unit fielding a company of either design. Production of the Grand Dragon continued unabated until the Jihad, when the Word of Blake devastated LAW's factories in 3068. It took two years for LAW to get new Grand Dragon factories up and running, the first on Nykvarn followed by Abiy Adi and Savinsville, and ensure the continued use of the 'Mech in years to come.

content.original:
Originally envisioned as a refresh to the GRN-D-02, the -03 introduced so many changes that a new chassis designation was needed. Dubbed the Grand Crusader II, the 'Mech is still built on an Endo Steel chassis, but now carries a much larger 320 light fusion engine to give it a top speed of 64.8 km/h and a much greater amount of survivability than the XL engine carried by earlier models. The 03 also carries Triple Strength Myomer to increase its ground speed to 86.4 km/h as long as it is running hot. The 'Mech has four jump jets to further increase its mobility. The variant carries fifteen tons of armor protection and is armed with two ER Large Lasers as its primary weapons, backed up by an LRM-15 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system. For close combat, the 'Mech has three ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 missile launcher. The 'Mech also carries an improved C3 computer, allowing it to share targeting data with friendly units. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Модель 04 была разработана как вариация 03 для дальнего боя, о чем можно судить по ее основному вооружению: легкой винтовке Гаусса и ER PPC, установленным в руках. Для ближнего боя мех имеет два средних лазера и ракетную установку Streak SRM-6. Мех также оснащен улучшенным блоком C3, как у модели 03, позволяющим ему обмениваться данными целеуказания с дружественными юнитами. Особенность: Стабильный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.14

To provide additional mobility, the Great Turtle is equipped with three torso-mounted Jump Jets. These allow the Great Turtle to get out of sticky situations relatively quickly. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The Great Turtle was designed as an experiment in MechWarrior safety. With the recovery of the Helm Memory Core, weapons technology had advanced more in the twenty years between the Fourth Succession War and the Clan Invasion than it had in the previous three hundred years. One effect of these advances in weapons was the dramatic reduction in a MechWarrior's life expectancy. Many weapons could destroy a 'Mech's head, engine, or gyro with one shot, leaving the MechWarrior dead or wounded. VEST took the concept of MechWarrior protection to an extreme. The Great Turtle uses a quad chassis to hold the maximum amount of armor possible. The Great Turtle's armor weighs 40 tons, as much as a Clint BattleMech. For more protection the VEST engineers used experimental Hardened Armor that effectively provides twice as much protection as standard armor. This means that the Great Turtle can take staggering amounts of damage without worrying the pilot. Enemies who target the 'Mech's head looking for a clean kill will be disappointed. The Hardened armor can withstand a Gauss rifle hit, but more importantly, the Great Turtle uses a Torso Mounted Cockpit to provide extra protection for the pilot. Using a standard engine reduces the possibility of an engine explosion, and a compact gyro further increases longevity.

content.original: The Capellans have rebuilt the Griffin from the skeleton up to take advantage of their new stealth armor. The engineers selected a XL fusion engine to allow for the larger LRM-15 launcher and Guardian ECM system; thirteen double-strength heat sinks are required to keep the design reasonably cool. Further upgrades include an Artemis IV targeting system to improve the accuracy of the missile rack and an ER PPC. Concerns about the fragility of using an XL engine was settled by allotting an additional 1.5 tons of armor. Finally, CASE protection for the ammunition bins was vital; while incapable of protecting the bulky engine, it allows the pilot to eject safely in the event of an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Finally, CASE protection for the ammunition bins was vital; while incapable of protecting the bulky engine, it allows the pilot to eject safely in the event of an ammunition explosion.

content.original: The 3LL is an alternative to the 3L, replacing the ER PPC with a ER Large Laser. The savings in weight permits adding one double heat sink and an additional ton of armor. Range and damage would be reduced, but the added protection and ability to fire both main weapons while in stealth mode – with no chance of overheating – is too good to resist. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Griffin 6R is an early prototype of what would eventually become the 6S. However, since it uses Streak SRM rather than LRM launchers and mounts so many medium lasers without enough cooling, it was felt it strayed too far from the core concept of the Griffins, and was eventually rejected for mass production. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
During the Combine-Ghost Bear War, Star Captain Scott of the Gurdel Bloodhouse came to fame for his customized Grizzly that has reignited this failed design. A potent urban defender, Scott's loadout is now a standard, with old Grizzlies being recalled for refit. The variant keeps the Gauss Rifle, but swaps out the pulse lasers for an ER Large Laser and six ER Micro Lasers. The missile launcher is replaced with an ATM 9 and two tons of ammunition. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: The Grizzly is a BattleMech that was developed by Clan Ghost Bear scientists in the 30th century. Unfortunately, the design excels at no one thing, so it never carved a niche in the Clan's touman. Thirteen tons of armor are mounted on an Endo Steel frame. Jump jets are mounted so that the Grizzly can leap up to 120 meters at a time. Aside from the 'jack of all trades, master of none' moniker, the Grizzly is also poorly engineered. Slagged armor tends to get stuck in joints and weapons, while the actuators are difficult to repair in their own right.

Jointly developed by the Federated Commonwealth and the Draconis Combine, the 85 ton Gunslinger entered production in 3053. Powered by a 255 rated XL Engine, the Gunslinger 2ERD is armed with a pair of Gauss Rifles. 4 Medium Lasers add additional fire power at close ranges. A Guardian ECM Suite and a C3 Master Computer enhance the Mechs capabilities, while a trio of Jump Jets increase mobility. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
Prototype Hellcat-Ps are identical to the current production iteration in nearly every aspect except for the engine. The heavier power plant's reduced top speed made it undesirable for many of Clan Jade Falcon's front-line light and medium Stars. It was soon relegated to solahma units. While there is demand to return to these under-engined specs by customers hoping for a bargain, discerning customers are instead referred to the standard model (for maximum profit via the XXL engine). Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: What is now known as the Hellcat had its humble origins in a Clan's desperation nearly a century ago. One of the many projects born out of Clan Nova Cat's post-Abjurement rebuilding program was a radical take on the Conjurer BattleMech. Jade Falcon merchants took advantage of their old rival's panic, swapping sorely needed raw materials for access to the Cats' ballooning catalog of 'Mech chassis. Falcon technicians and scientists reworked an atypical Conjurer variant to emphasize flexible firepower over the Nova Cat model's speed and energy-based weaponry. Named as a subtle wink to both the BattleMech's creators and the Conjurer's Spheroid name, their early Hellcat saw only limited production before the Jihad.

content.original:
Used by Word of Blake, the 5C variant of the Hermes II was introduced in 3062 and takes aspects of the 2M and 4K variants. The chassis has been upgraded to endo steel and the 'Mech is powered by an extralight engine. The primary weapon is an ER large laser in place of the AC/5, backed up with three ER medium lasers. Finally, the 5C carries an improved Narc missile beacon and an improved C3 computer to allow it to assist other friendly units in targeting enemy units. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: Scout
content.prevOriginal: Scout
content.content: Разведка

content.original: The Hermes II was first produced in 2798, based on the original Hermes BattleMech that had been used by the Star League. A heavy scout, the Hermes II boasted respectable weaponry, armoring, and speed, allowing it to easily brawl with lighter 'Mechs or survive an encounter with heavier 'Mechs and retreat. Out of all medium-weight 'Mechs at the time the Hermes II was the easiest to perform field maintenance on, leading to its nickname 'old reliable.' As combination scout and light strike platforms, Hermes II 'Mechs often operated alone, employed for missions for which lighter 'Mechs were too fragile and heavier 'Mechs too clumsy. The Hermes II was in its element when operating in a restrictive environment like a forest or city, where it could employ a most unusual tactic of setting its surroundings on fire to escape pursuit. Since most 'Mech pilots would naturally avoid a fire to prevent overheating and the flames interfered with most thermal scanners, starting a blaze allowed the Hermes II to more easily slip away.

content.original: This variant uses an Endo Steel chassis and 300 rated XL Engine to save weight. The larger engine allows it to reach a top speed of 96km/h. It carries an ER Medium Laser in each arm and a single SRM-6 in the left torso. The main hitting power comes from an LB 20-X autocannon in the right torso. The SRM has a ton of ammunition, while the autocannon has two tons of ammo. It is protected by ten tons of armor and carries ten double heat sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: The Infiltrator Mk. II is a battle armor suit designed as a replacement for the earlier Infiltrator Mk. I. With better armament and protection than its predecessor, the Mk. II was superior in all ways except cost. A battle armor-scale Magshot rifle provides firepower while an anti-infantry SMG provides light defense. A suite of stealth armor keeps the suit protected on the field. The only serious downside is the slow ground speed of the Mk. II, though jump jets help keep the suit semi-mobile. Quirk: Stealth Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount any unit, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
The 005 King Crab is an upgraded version of the 000 model introduced in 3062. The autocannons have been upgraded to LB-X Autocannon/20s and the large laser has been upgraded to an ER Large Laser. The LRM-15 has been completely removed from the ‘Mech and replaced with two Streak SRM-4s. The final upgrade is the inclusion of an improved C3 computer to allow the King Crab to work in concert with up to five other units sharing targeting telemetry. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Custom built from discarded Locust wrecks, the Koto is a 25 ton mech built exclusively for the Solaris 7 arenas by Omnitech Industries. Sharing the same basic shape as it's parent design the Koto is extensively rebuilt with an Endo Steel skeleton, Ferro-Fibrous armour, double heat sinks and an XL Engine. Weighing 5 tons heavier then the Locust, the Koto has a significantly heavier weapons array; built for annihilating opponents in the arena. The Koto 3A is armed with a Large Pulse Laser, 2 Medium Lasers and a Small Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
The 5M was a straightforward enhancement of the 3M model, upgrading all of the lasers to extended range models, giving it one Magna Mk VI ER Medium Laser and four Magna Mk IV ER Small Lasers. In addition, the use of a Hermes 240 XL Engine allowed engineers to upgrade the Locust's top speed to 194.4 km/h. Designed by the Word of Blake, each of their Level III units had at least one 5M Locust after its introduction in 3066. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Longbow, introduced in 2480, has seen service in the armies of the Inner Sphere since the days of the Star League and is one of the most well-known fire support 'Mechs in existence. As a fire-support 'Mech though, the Longbow is a trusted and reliable machine that can be counted on to carry out the mission it is designed for. The primary weapons on the Longbow are its LRM launchers, four in all, a pair of 20s and a pair of 5s, letting the Longbow put out 50 LRMs into any target it can see.

This short-lived version was the prototype for the MTR-6K. Its equipment, heat sinks, and armor configuration is identical to the -6K variant. The weapon configuration tested showed that the ER Large Laser and ER PPC would quickly overwhelm the reduced cooling system, which led to the downrated weapons used on the -6K. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
This scout version designed by Telfar BattleMechs and also produced by Norse-Storm BattleMechs has seen limited success. It adds a Beagle Active Probe and Guardian ECM Suite. In order to make way for them, two heat sinks were removed and the pulse lasers were downgraded to standard Medium Lasers. A pair of Small Lasers were added to make up for the lost firepower, but the lost accuracy is sorely missed. Since the loss of heat sinks put the Maelstrom in danger of building heat, the extended range weapons were downgraded to a Large Laser and PPC respectively. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The MCY-102 is an upgrade to the Mercury introduced in 3067 by the Word of Blake. This variant retains the engine, MASC, and armor of the MCY-99 but carries two major modifications. The first is the rebuilding of the chassis using Endo Steel. The change in the chassis construction and removal of one small and one medium laser allows for the second modification: the installation of an Improved C3 Computer, making it capable of operating with five other units in a C3i unit. Both of the remaining lasers were also changed out for extended range models. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

content.original: The Nexus II is the natural evolution of the Nexus, based on the NXS1-B model. A reason for the chassis rename instead of just creating more original Nexus variants, was an attempt to get rid of its bad reputation and address many of its shortcomings.

content.original:
Another version of the Nexus II, the NXS2-B is geared more towards electronic warfare and removes all six of the jump jets of the NXS2-A and replaces them with a Guardian ECM Suite and a Beagle Active Probe. Featuring Stealth Armor to enhance its reconnaissance abilities, the two ER Small Lasers have been replaced with a TAG target designation laser. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
Considered the progenitor of the Nexus II, the NXS1-B variant of the standard NXS1-A intended to make the 'Mech more capable as a recon unit, the B variant completely restructures the 'Mechs arsenal and reworks the Nexus into a powerful scout 'Mech. Clad in four tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the NXS1-B is capable of jumping up to one hundred and fifty meters and carries two ER Medium Lasers as its primary weapons. These are backed up by an ER Small Laser. What makes this Nexus variant so effective as a recon 'Mech is its Improved C3 unit that allows it to share targeting data with up to five allied units. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The BattleMech known as the Nexus was originally based on the Jackrabbit, a light scout and combat vehicle and infantry support 'Mech built for the Star League Defense Force by Skobel MechWorks. Ironically, the Jackrabbit ended testing two weeks before Stefan Amaris seized power on Terra and was instead primarily used by units loyal to Amaris against the SLDF in General Kerensky's drive to liberate the Terran Hegemony. Though the SLDF captured Skobel's plant relatively intact, thanks to the stigma of being used against his forces Kerensky ordered it shutdown and the unloved Jackrabbit disappeared into history outside of ComStar's records. With the Com Guards looking to recoup their grievous losses in the wake of the Battle of Tukayyid, in 3054 Precentor Martial Anastasius Focht ordered the Skobel plant reactivated, reworking the slower Jackrabbit into a fast and highly mobile recon striker 'Mech he renamed the Nexus.

content.original:
The heavy laser variant only mounts one, a Heavy Large Laser. A Gauss Rifle gives it long-range firepower, while an Ultra Autocannon/10 is effective at medium and short range. A Medium Pulse Laser is an accurate backup weapon. Five heat sinks are added to ensure the design never has to worry about heat. An ECM Suite provides protection against some enemy electronics. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Orion K was the first true heavy 'Mech. As a multirole brawler, the Orion can engage enemies at a variety of ranges, and with plenty of armor, it can survive combined fire for quite some time. Slow, yes, but powerful.

content.original:
The 2M is another upgrade of the Orion using Star League technology. Built in 3063 the 'Mech uses an Endo Steel chassis and utilizes ten double-strength heat sinks to save weight and for their greater heat-dissipation ability. For long-range combat, the ON2-M is armed with a Gauss Rifle as well as an LRM-15 linked to an Artemis IV FCS for increased accuracy. For closer ranges, the 'Mech has three medium pulse lasers. The ON2-M is armored with twelve and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: The 4Z variant of the Pillager is built to provide an almost perfect long range sniper 'Mech. The new Stealth armor makes it harder to hit, as does the required Guardian ECM Suite. In order to do fit these changes, the 'Mech has had two medium lasers and the Large Laser removed. The remaining medium lasers have been upgraded to ER medium lasers. The Pillager has also replaced the XL engine with a standard engine and added CASE for more reliability, so the 'Mech can survive a side torso destruction. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

content.original: The largest BattleMech ever built by HildCo Interplanetary, the Pillager is built as a larger version of the Victor, and is intended for assaulting urban centers and hardened fortifications. These design parameters were paramount as the SLDF mobilized to wage the Reunification War. Later Pillagers were upgraded with more cutting-edge Star League technology. Production of the Pillager halted not because its facility was destroyed, but the advanced Gauss rifle and XL engine production lines had been obliterated by the end of the Second Succession War. Curiously, HildCo did not restart production of the original PLG-1N, rather the Pillager lines only began production again in 3058 when advanced components were once again available for the PLG-3Z.

content.original: The Procyon is the first ProtoMech designed and built by Clan Coyote. A pair of ER Small Lasers makes the Procyon one of the best armed ProtoMechs available. With their ammunition independence and decent range and damage potential, the standard Procyon can inflict as much damage as an Elemental. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: One of the best first generation ProtoMechs, the Centaur combines high speed, decent armor, and a varied weapons mix. These features make it a flexible combatant, able to keep up with scout 'Mechs while supporting them. The SRM and LRM missile launchers provide much of the striking power of the Centaur, backed up ER Micro Laser.

content.original: The Purifier Adaptive battle armor is produced by Word of Blake, though the original data was stolen from ComStar. The Purifier Adaptive is revolutionary in that it uses mimetic, color-shifting armor. The Mimetic Armor makes the Purifier Adaptive much more difficult to target, especially when it is motionless. The drawback comes in the amount of armor it carries. Quirk: Mimetic Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.872 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The 8K variant of the Quickdraw brings it up to 3062 weapons standards. The 'Mech is built using an endo steel chassis and is armored with eight and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor. The 'Mech's arsenal has also been stripped and upgraded, carrying four forward-mounted ER medium lasers and an MRM-30 launcher, a compromise between the LRMs and SRMs of past models, supplied by two tons of ammunition. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: The Quickdraw was originally built in 2779 as a replacement for the Rifleman BattleMech. While it was unsuccessful in supplanting the Rifleman, over time the Quickdraw proved itself to be a good generalist 'Mech. Packing excellent firepower, solid armor protection and above-average speed, it quickly earned the respect of many MechWarriors and status as a workhorse in every Successor State's military.

content.original:
The first of the Raijin II designs, the 200-A model completely redesigns the 'Mech to enhance its combat capabilities and is built on an Endo Steel chassis to save weight. Increased ground speed is achieved through the use of Triple Strength Myomers that increases the 'Mech's top speed to 118.8 km/h under the proper conditions. The 200-A model is protected by a respectable eleven tons of standard armor; giving it superior armor protection to older models. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC as its primary weapon. This is supported by three ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-4 launcher for close combat. The RJN-200-A also carries a C3i Computer, allowing it to share targeting data with friendly units. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Raijin was designed after the Battle of Tukayyid to rearm ComGuard units that had suffered losses in the campaign. Despite having stockpiled Star League-era BattleMechs at his disposal, Precentor Martial Focht wanted something unfamiliar to both the Inner Sphere and the Clans.

content.content: The Raijin was designed after the Battle of Tukayyid to rearm ComGuard units that had suffered losses in the campaign. Despite having stockpiled Star League-era BattleMechs at his disposal, Precentor Martial Focht wanted something unfamiliar to both the Inner Sphere and the Clans.

content.original:
Intended to act as a heavy scout, the 200-B uses the 200-A as its base. The 'Mech has Stealth Armor that makes it extremely hard to hit when activated and carries the ECM suite that is needed with any stealth armor system. The 'Mech also has a TAG laser designator, a Beagle Active Probe, and an improved C3 system. The only drawback to all of the advanced electronics is that when the stealth armor is activated the 'Mech is subject to its own ECM system, effectively blocking its own improved C3 system. The 200-B carries four ER Medium Lasers and an ER Small Laser to defend itself. Additionally, to increase its survivability, the 200-B uses a light fusion engine. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The 200-C takes the concept of the 101-A and the 200-B and combines the best of them making an agile, long-range sniper 'Mech that is extremely hard to hit. This is done by combining the light fusion engine, Stealth Armor and ECM suite of the 200-B model with the armament and Triple Strength Myomer of the 200-A model. The 200-C is armed with an ER PPC for long range combat which is backed up by two ER Medium Lasers. The 'Mech is also linked to an improved C3 network, making it one of the most impressive sniper 'Mechs. However, it should be noted that its stealth armor interferes with the C3 network while active, requiring the pilot to choose between improved accuracy or stealth. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A greatly improved version of the Raijin, the C model turns the 'Mech into a powerful close range brawler. This necessitated that the 'Mech's entire arsenal be stripped and replaced, as well as the addition of one and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech's primary weapon is a Large Pulse Laser, backed up by three ER Medium Lasers, and a Streak SRM-6. Finally, the 'Mech also incorporates an improved C3 system that allows it to provide targeting data to friendly units. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Designed as a fast foot scout for battle armor units, the Rottweiler pushes the envelope of what ground speed battle armor can reach. Clad in BA-grade stealth armor and equipped with ECM, the Rottweiler makes for a hard target. However, this speed and evasiveness comes with a price: the Rottweiler is lightly armed. Each suit carries a Small Laser as primary armament and carries a Firedrake incendiary needler as a backup weapon. While not a lot of firepower, it was judged to be acceptable by the Lyran Alliance and the suit was put into production. Quirk: Stealth Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can only mount internal bays, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original: The Satyr ProtoMech was designed to serve as a deep raider and reconnaissance unit. Offering only slightly more protection than a Harpy or Siren, the Satyr's best defense is to remain hidden from enemy units. First introduced during the 3060s, this variant drops the original weaponry for an increase in mobility with the addition of Jump Jets and increased armor. Leftover weight allowed the Satyr 2 to mount a single Micro Pulse Laser. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

content.original:
This configuration focuses on long-range combat with an ER PPC, a pair of ER Large Lasers, and two ATM 9s that carry enough ammunition to be effective at all ranges. Three ER Medium Lasers provide medium to close range support, while a Targeting Computer aids the accuracy of all the energy weapons. Three jump jets give the 'Mech some extra maneuverability. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: One of the first mass production QuadMechs, the 55 ton Scorpion entered production in 2570 as an infantry support unit. Shunned by most MechWarriors due to it's notoriously unstable gait, the Scorpion would nevertheless see uninterrupted use throughout the Succession Wars and beyond. The Scorpion 12C is powered by a 330 rated XL Engine giving it a top speed of 97km/h. An ER PPC, iNARC and an ER Small Laser form the Mechs weapons load. A C3i module allows the Mech to share data with other C3i equipped Mechs. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: One of the first mass production QuadMechs, the 55 ton Scorpion entered production in 2570 as an infantry support unit. Shunned by most MechWarriors due to it's notoriously unstable gait, the Scorpion would nevertheless see uninterrupted use throughout the Succession Wars and beyond. The Scoprion 1NW is a custom refit created by Wendall Puritan of the Smithson's Chinese Bandits. content.original: The Siren ProtoMech was originally designed by Clan Smoke Jaguar to serve as a reconnaissance unit. Its high speed allowed it to rush forward, find enemy forces, call in a missile strike, and evacuate without the enemy being able to see them. This variant was armed with a pair of SRM-1 Launchers. To fit the large weapons, the Siren's speed was reduced to 120 km/h. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

In preparation for a rumored technology exchange with Norse-Storm Technologies, which hopes to equip its own Spectors with Capellan stealth armor, Shengli Arms acquired several examples of the 'Mech with an eye towards developing their own version. Using recent advances in battle suit mimetic armor technology, they built the SPR-7L, a truly stealthy 'Mech tailored to cover a wide variety of missions. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: Reintroduced in 3053, the Spector mounts a Magna 245 XL engine in combination with an XL Engine and an  Endo Steel chassis. It carries seven and a half tons of armor along with seven jump jets. The Spector carries a Nightwind Large Laser as its primary weapon,  backed up by a pair of Defiance B3M Medium Lasers and a single Defiance B4S Small Laser for close combat. Defensively the Spector carries a Norse Guardian ECM Suite that allows it to defend itself against advanced enemy targeting and range finding equipment.

content.original: The 7K is an upgrade of the base design, introduced by Nimakachi in 3067 and based on the success of other revitalized classic designs. It's built using an Endo Steel structure and five and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, a Light Fusion Engine in place of the standard model, and carries two Medium Pulse Lasers. Perhaps most critically, Nimakachi was able to finally install an ejection system in the 7K. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Irian’s attempt to make up for the shortcomings of the 5M, the 6M introduced in 3062 drops the SRMs and Narc entirely, upgrades the LRMs to 15-tube racks with integral Artemis IV FCS and three tons of reloads each, and upgrades the lasers to ER versions, mounting a fifth medium. Most importantly, the LRM magazines are now protected with CASE. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The 7D Stalker introduced by the Federated Suns in 3062 is built on a standard chassis and engine for rugged durability and carries a primarily energy arsenal. Its two primary weapons are two ER PPCs, giving the 7D a striking distance out to just under seven hundred meters. The 'Mech is also armed with four Medium Pulse Lasers for close combat, which are backed up by two Streak SRM-4 launchers to take advantage of any weak points in an enemy's armor. The lasers and ER PPCs are all linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, which gives the 7D extreme accuracy. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Introduced by the Lyran Alliance in 3064, the STK-8S is built around a new Light Fusion Engine which frees up some tonnage for heavier weapons. The 8S is armed with two ER PPCs for long-range combat. When it closes with an enemy it can bring its new Heavy Gauss Rifle to bear at intermediate to short ranges. Finally, for short range combat, the 8S carries two Medium Pulse Lasers and two ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: The Tarantula was designed specifically for a reconnaissance role. The 'Mech is built around a massive 200 XL engine, which provides the Tarantula with a top speed approaching 130 km/h. The 'Mech is also equipped with eight jump jets which can be used to propel the 'Mech up to 240 meters allowing the Tarantula to easily navigate rough terrain.

content.original: Changes in the way the Clans fight since they made contact with the Inner Sphere led scientists from Clan Steel Viper to revisit the Vapor Eagle. They stripped out all the weaponry, but left everything else alone. This variant is effective at long range, as it mounts a Clan Mk. XVII ER PPC. The Fang Series-A ATM 3 replaced the Machine Guns of the original, though it only mounts one ton of ammunition, so the launcher loses the all-important flexibility of the Advanced Tactical Missile System. For close range, three Series 5K Heavy Medium Lasers provide a powerful punch, while a pair of Pattern D-II SRM-2 launchers add more damage potential. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
The 4L Vindicator is a major upgrade to the design, part of Ceres Metals' efforts to revive the line in 3063. The engine has been replaced with a 225-rated XL engine, granting the 'Mech a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and its jumping distance was increased to 150 meters with an additional jump jet. The 'Mech uses double heat sinks for its advanced weapons load, which includes an ER PPC and LRM-5 for striking power at long range and an ER medium laser and medium pulse laser for short range work. Finally, the 'Mech carries a Guardian ECM Suite and is protected with nine tons of Stealth Armor, making it harder to target at range. The 4L became a common design among Shadow Lances following their introduction. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

The 'Mech uses double heat sinks for its advanced weapons load, which includes an ER PPC and LRM-5 for striking power at long range and an ER medium laser and medium pulse laser for short range work. Finally, the 'Mech carries a Guardian ECM Suite and is protected with nine tons of Stealth Armor, making it harder to target at range. The 4L became a common design among Shadow Lances following their introduction. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower
content.content:
The 4L Vindicator is a major upgrade to the design, part of Ceres Metals' efforts to revive the line in 3063. The engine has been replaced with a 225-rated XL engine, granting the 'Mech a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and its jumping distance was increased to 150 meters with an additional jump jet. The 'Mech uses double heat sinks for its advanced weapons load, which includes an ER PPC and LRM-5 for striking power at long range and an ER medium laser and medium pulse laser for short range work. Finally, the 'Mech carries a Guardian ECM Suite and is protected with nine tons of Stealth Armor, making it harder to target at range. The 4L became a common design among Shadow Lances following their introduction. Особенность: Прочный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.03

Лимит приводов рук: Right Lower

content.original: The Vindicator is one of the most well-known Capellan Confederation BattleMechs. This workhorse of the CCAF was originally built in 2826 between the First and Second Succession War to maximize the effectiveness of the Confederation's surviving production capabilities and fulfill as many roles as possible. Designed by committee, the Vindicator's 'jack-of-all-trades' nature means it does not excel in any one role but fulfills them adequately. With almost all of its components produced on Capella, the Vindicator is also cheap, easy to mass produce, and quick to repair with a ready supply of spare parts.

content.original: The Void is a battle armor design that is produced by the Draconis Combine. The Void is protected by stealth armor and is a fairly mobile jump-capable battle armor. Armed with a single Support PPC, the Void is capable of moderate suppressing fire against larger targets. The stealth armor ensures it takes minimal return fire and the Support PPC guarantees the Void is useful on most battlefields. Quirk: Void Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original:
The Warhawk M configuration combines two Large Pulse Lasers and two ER Large Lasers with an ATM 6. Even with 23 heat sinks the cooling is not quite sufficient to handle the created heat of repeated alpha strikes, so any piloting MechWarrior has to pace the 'Mech accordingly. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: The 8C variant of the Wolverine, introduced by Victory Industries in 3067 after the success of the 8K, is built on an Endo Steel chassis and uses an XL Engine for power. It carries a large pulse laser as its primary weapon, as well as a medium pulse laser and a small pulse laser. For additional close-combat capability this version carries two Streak SRM-6 launchers while a C3 Slave Unit allows it to share targeting telemetry with friendly units but only carries thirteen double heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 8D Wolverine is an one of two updated versions introduced by Kallon in 3066 that incorporates some of the newest equipment to the AFFS. The 'Mech is built with an Endo Steel chassis and uses an XL engine augmented with MASC, enabling speeds of up to 108 km/h. Its main gun is a Rotary Autocannon/2, backed up by an ER Medium Laser and a Streak SRM-6 launcher. Both the Rotary Autocannon and the ER Medium Laser are linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, making the Wolverine extremely accurate. However the design carries only ten double heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 8K Wolverine was first introduced for the Combine in 3064 when Victory Industries decided to update the design. It is built using an XL engine for power and uses fifteen double heat sinks for its high heat load. This variant carries a ER PPC backed up by an ER Medium Laser, both in the right arm, and a Medium Pulse Laser in the head. Finally, to exploit any weak points in an enemy's armor, the 'Mech carries a Streak SRM-6 launcher in the left torso along with one ton of ammo. Twelve tons of armor with CASE provide additional protection. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 9D Wolverine is the companion of the 8D and shares some similarities, such as the Endo Steel chassis and the XL engine. First fielded at the same time as the 8D the 'Mech carries, as its main weapon, a Rotary Autocannon/2 backed up by two medium pulse lasers and a Streak SRM-6 launcher. It also carries a TAG laser designator, to designate targets for Arrow IV artillery attacks. Unlike the 8D, this variant does not jump, though it does retain the MASC and has twelve double heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Wraith marked Curtiss Militech's entry into BattleMech production. When the design was announced, many felt that the design would be little more than a walking water cooler. What the critics got was a shock. The Wraith is a 'Mech that, when properly employed, can wreak havoc on an enemy with its astounding speed and maneuverability. It is built around a massive LTV 385 XL Engine that allows it to reach speeds of just under 119 kph. The Wraith has a simple, yet effective, pulse weapons payload. Pulse laser weaponry allows the Mech to negate most of the side effects on accuracy that are introduced by the Wraith's heavy use of jump jets, making it incredibly accurate and powerful for such a lightly armed Mech. A modification of the Wraith made by the Word of Blake, the TR3 replaces the two Medium Pulse Lasers with two ER Medium Lasers while one of the jump jets is removed to make room for an improved C3 computer, making the Wraith an incredibly powerful point 'Mech for units equipped with C3i equipment. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Ares Medium Tank (ATM) is designed to stand off and take down its enemies at long range. Its top speed of 86 km/h is fast for a fire support vehicle, so it is often paired with APC to support infantry. Four and a half tons of armor protect the vehicle and its crew; this somewhat meager amount encourages Ares crews to stay out of range of most return fire. The main weapon is an ER Large Laser mounted in the turret. Mounted in the front is an ATM-12. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 115 20 Left 90 20 Right 90 20 Rear 70 20 Turret 100 20 Total 465 100 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

Carrying an array of ranged weapons, the Assault VTOL is designed to smash targets at range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 6/9 Hex: 180/270 Meters. content.original: Introduced in 3054, the Cavalry Attack Helicopter was one of a number of VTOLs developed to fight the Clans by Michaelson Heavy Industries. Suited to hit-and-run engagements rather than front-line combat situations the Cavalry gained a reputation for flawless service when used correctly. It has since seen service in former FedCom States and minor-nobles among the Chaos March. While capable of speeds up to 162 km/h, the Cavalry doesn't rely on this alone for protection and has 3.5 tons armor. The craft can handle a direct hit from a Clan-tech ER PPC on the nose and keep flying. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 90 15 Right 90 15 Rear 65 15 Total 360 75 Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile

content.original: The Centipede Scout Car was produced by Gienah Combat Vehicles & Red Devil Industries in 3053. The vehicle was originally intended for reconnaissance ahead of its command unit to spot hidden units, but the Centipede SRM variant is a battlefield modification created during the FedCom Civil War in 3062 specifically altered to be utilized as a quick striker in hit and run attacks. It removes all original equipment of the standard model in favor of six SRM-2 missile launchers with a single ton of ammunition to significantly boost firepower at the cost of losing its advanced sensors and scouting capabilities. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 80 10 Left 80 10 Right 80 10 Rear 80 10 Total 320 40 Quirk: Nimble

content.original: The Centipede Scout Car was produced by Gienah Combat Vehicles & Red Devil Industries in 3053. The vehicle is intended for reconnaissance ahead of its command unit, spotting hidden units. Introduced during the FedCom Civil War in 3067, this customer-ordered variant was first provided to the 7th Donegal Guards's Armor Brigade. This variant replaces the vehicle's medium laser in favor of a TAG. The vehicle has increased armor protection and receives a Guardian ECM for added defense. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. content.original: Designed as an inexpensive alternative to Mechs, the 45 ton Glaive Medium Tank entered service with the Skye Rangers in 3066. Powered by a 205 rated Fusion Engine, the Glaive can reach a top speed of 86 kph and is protected by 5 and a half tons of armour. An ER Large Laser and an Artemis IV enhanced LRM-15 are supplemented by a pair of Machine Guns for close range combat. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 140 25 Left 100 25 Right 100 25 Rear 80 25 Turret 95 25 Total 515 125 Quirk: Variable Range Targeting
