content.original: The Hephaestus Scout Tank is an OmniVehicle produced exclusively by Clan Hell's Horses. All variants of the Hephaestus incorporate a sizable infantry bay as well as an Active Probe to locate hidden units. A support variant introduced in 3064, the Hephaestus A mounts an LRM-15 in its turret along with an Artemis IV Fire Control System. A single ton of ammunition does not allow for a high rate of fire for an extended period of time. Supplementing the missile launcher is a single ER Small Laser. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 8/12 Hex: 240/360 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 100 15 Left 100 15 Right 100 15 Rear 90 15 Turret 90 15 Total 480 75 Quirk: Missile Jammer Omni Vehicle

content.original: Rasasa means 'Bullet' in Arabic. The Ifrit VTOL Strike Craft was designed to intercept and delay armored advances. Reactive armor, a Jet Booster and redundant AMS increase it's chances of getting close enough to deploy it's large payload of mines and Inferno. The Ifrit Rasasa variant swaps the base model's SRM for a gauss cannon and medium lasers. The inferno and FASCAM bombs are generally traded for guided missiles for tank hunting. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 9/14 Hex: 270/420 Meters. content.original: The Karnov UR Transport is a heavy lift VTOL which has been in service for hundreds of years. The tilt-rotor design is one of the fastest of its type in use. A reliable and hardy machine, all of the Successor State armed forces and many mercenary units employ Karnovs for supply and logistics missions. Many commercial firms also use the machine for local transportation of cargo in its sizable 6-ton bay or as a flying crane. Mounting a pair of ER Medium Lasers and two tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor, this Karnov variant can deploy battle armored infantry directly from its twelve ton cargo bay. To provide electronic protection a Guardian ECM Suite is mounted in the nose. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 10/15 Hex: 300/450 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 50 15 Left 40 15 Right 40 15 Rear 30 15 Total 175 75 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: The Main Gauche Light Support Tank is a fire support companion to Brooks Incorporated's Galleon. Though slower, topping out at only 64 km/h, five tons of armor protect it. The Main Gauche was actually submitted to the Free Worlds League Military because that organization was looking for a tank with long range capability. It finally reached full production in 3064. The main gun of the Main Gauche is an Imperator Type II Light Gauss Rifle, a weapon that has an incredible range. The single magazine carries a ton of ammunition. In order to mount this, however, the tank forgoes speed, armor, a turret, and close-range weaponry. Its only backup is a pair of Voelkers Machine Guns, which are only a credible threat to unarmored infantry. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 145 15 Left 95 15 Right 95 15 Rear 65 15 Total 400 60 Quirk: Quick Off The Line

content.original: The Main Gauche Light Support Tank is a fire support companion to Brooks Incorporated's Galleon. Though slower, topping out at only 64 km/h, five tons of armor protect it. The Main Gauche was actually submitted to the Free Worlds League Military because that organization was looking for a tank with long range capability. It finally reached full production in 3064. This variant introduced in 3066 removes the Machine Guns to add a C3 Slave Unit and an ER Small Laser. While this lessens short-range damage potential, it makes the Light Gauss Rifle much more accurate if another unit in its C3 network is close to the Main Gauche's target. This makes it even more advantageous for the light tank to stay at extreme range. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. content.original: The Morningstar City Command Vehicle is designed to coordinate battles that take place within urban centers. Though it was ostensibly created to coordinate defensive operations in said areas, it has proven equally adept at going on the offensive. The Morningstar is built around a C3 computer that can coordinate friendly units. Four tons of cargo space let's it ferry infantry into the battle. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: The Musketeer hover tank is a combat vehicle designed to deliver concentrated firepower quickly and cheaply. The hovertank is as difficult to kill as a hover vehicle can be, with seven tons of ferro-fibrous armor protecting it, and CASE protecting its four-person crew from internal explosions. An ICE is inexpensive and can still maintain speeds up to 119 km/h. The Musketeer was created to deliver a Mydron Tornado RAC/5 to the field. Three tons of ammunition give the Musketeer's crew the ability to maintain sustained fire. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 180 25 Left 135 25 Right 135 25 Rear 100 25 Turret 140 25 Total 690 125 Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics

content.original: First appearing in 3056, the Palisade Defense Tank is a 60 ton defensive tank found throughout the wealthier parts of the Periphery. Based on an older tank design dating back to the Succession Wars, the Palisade is designed as a multi role tank capable of engaging Mechs or Vehicles. Capable of speeds of 60 kph, the Palisade (MRM) is powered by a 240 rated Fuel Cell and carries 12 tons of armour. The main gun is an LB-10X, with a MRM-20 supporting this at shorter ranges. An MG provides some limited anti infantry capabilities. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 260 30 Left 185 30 Right 185 30 Rear 150 30 Turret 195 30 Total 975 150 Quirk: Main Battle Tank

content.original: Mounting a pair each of Rotary AC/5s and LB 2-X ACs, the 3067 RAC variant of the Partisan is able to pump out a significant amount of gunfire in a short amount of time. It also adds another ton of armor for increase durability. This 3069 variant also uses an XL engine, but mounts four Rotary AC/2s, a Targeting Computer, and a C3 slave unit to trade targeting data. The armor protection has been increased by nearly 45% over the base XL variant. Kallon Industries, famous for designing some of the most popular anti-aircraft 'Mechs in the Inner Sphere, designed the Partisan to bring those same capabilities onto a cheaper, more easily produced vehicle. Dedicated to destroying aircraft, its targeting system can track up to 200 targets at once, compute the optimal target, and link to the targeting systems of other Partisans in the unit. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous Structure: Structure Values A S Front 200 40 Left 160 40 Right 160 40 Rear 130 40 Turret 200 40 Total 850 200 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting
content.prevOriginal: Mounting a pair each of Rotary AC/5s and LB 2-X ACs, the 3067 RAC variant of the Partisan is able to pump out a significant amount of gunfire in a short amount of time. It also adds another ton of armor for increase durability. This 3069 variant also uses an XL engine, but mounts four Rotary AC/2s, a Targeting Computer, and a C3 slave unit to trade targeting data. The armor protection has been increased by nearly 45% over the base XL variant. Kallon Industries, famous for designing some of the most popular anti-aircraft 'Mechs in the Inner Sphere, designed the Partisan to bring those same capabilities onto a cheaper, more easily produced vehicle. Dedicated to destroying aircraft, its targeting system can track up to 200 targets at once, compute the optimal target, and link to the targeting systems of other Partisans in the unit. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: Produced for the LAAF as a battle armor platoon carrier, even with an XL engine the extra weight required limits the craft to a single Small Pulse Laser and one ton of heavy ferro-fibrous armor. The Ripper, built from proven components for maximum reliability, uses a fusion engine to give the vehicle a significant range, as well as a high top speed, so much that the infantry compartment is equipped with special acceleration couches to handle the strain of a high speed combat insertion. content.original: Derided by critics and loved by it’s crews, the 25 ton Venator is a VTOL designed to hunt tanks. Slower then other contemporary VTOL’s, the low cost Venator makes up for it’s slower speed by mounting an AC/10 or a large missile launcher, giving it exceptionally heavy fire power for it’s small size. Produced by a handful of companies in the Periphery, the Venator is a common sight on the battlefields of the Periphery where it is often fielded in large quantities. ICE: Air breathing Combustion Engine. This unit can not deploy in thin atmosphere. Movement: 7/11 Hex: 210/330 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 65 15 Left 50 15 Right 50 15 Rear 40 15 Total 220 75 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting

content.original:
A complete upgrade of the original design, the 01B variant replaces the XL engine with a Light Fusion Engine. To make up for the weight lost to the engine, the entire weapons arsenal has been re-evaluated and the 'Mech carries a new weapons compliment. The primary long-range weapons are a pair of LRM-5 launchers. For intermediate ranges, the 01B model carries an Ultra Autocannon/10 and a PPC providing it with a powerful punch. Finally, for close range combat, the 'Mech has four Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-2 launcher. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

The First Federated Suns Armored Cavalry fields a limited variant that better matches their rapid raiding tactics. The BNDR-01D1 trades the twin LRM launchers for two BlazeFire Sweetshot extended range large lasers and another ton of armor. The increased heat is a drawback, but the First’s technicians compensate by installing an additional three double heat sinks in the ‘Mech’s torso Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: The Basilisk ProtoMech was designed and built by Clan Cloud Cobra to support their Elemental and OmniMech forces. Unlike most second generation Protos, the Basilisk has a relatively low top speed. The Basilisk mounts a 'Mech sized ER Medium Laser. Paired with the laser is a three tube LRM launcher used to soften up targets as the Basilisk unit closes. The only problem with this is the severely limited ammunition supply. Quirk: Heavy ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9

content.original: The 4S variant of the BattleMaster is a new look at an old 'Mech. Introduced by Red Devil Industries in cooperation with J.B. BattleMechs in 3062, the 4S is built on a StarFrame Heavy chassis, powered by a 340 VOX Light Fusion Engine, and armored with thirteen and a half tons of ArcShield Maxi X Ferro-fibrous armor. The long-range firepower comes from a Zeus Slingshot Gauss rifle in the right arm, fed by three tons of reloads in the right torso. The 'Mech also carries four RAMTech 1500Z ER medium lasers and two Defiance B3M medium lasers split between the side torso for intermediate ranges, as well as a TharHes Maxi SRM-6 with two tons of reloads and an Artemis IV fire control system in the left torso. For anti-infantry combat, this BattleMaster carries two Defiance P5S Small Pulse Lasers in the left arm and CASE to protect its munitions. The electronics were replaced by an O/P 3000 COMSET and a Cyclops Multi-Tasker 10 T&T system. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: The 5M was an upgrade that reflected the weapon trends in the Free Worlds League prior to the Jihad. Based on examples captured from Kristen's Krushers and using the BLR-3M as a base, the 'Mech was armed with a Light Gauss Rifle, giving it a range exceeding seven hundred meters. The Light Gauss is backed up by an ER Large Laser for long-range engagements while for close ranges, the 5M carries six ER medium lasers, two of which are rear facing. These models were first fielded in 3067. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original:
The CM (C3 Master) variant of the BattleMaster was built by the Kuritans in 3064 to command a C3 company. A smaller engine means the 'Mech's speed has been reduced to 54 km/h in order to allow it to carry a C3 master computer. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC, two ER medium lasers, and a Shigunga MRM 30. It is armored with sixteen tons of armor to better protect the valuable computers that allow it to coordinate an entire company. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower
content.prevOriginal:
The CM (C3 Master) variant of the BattleMaster was built by the Kuritans in 3064 to command a C3 company. A smaller engine means the 'Mech's speed has been reduced to 54 km/h in order to allow it to carry a C3 master computer. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC, two ER medium lasers, and a Shigunga MRM 30. It is armored with sixteen tons of armor to better protect the valuable computers that allow it to coordinate an entire company. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Another Kuritan 'Mech that was built to utilize C3 technology, the K3 BattleMaster was introduced the same year as the CM but uses an XL engine. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC and two ER large lasers for long-range combat with four ER medium lasers and a Streak SRM-6 launcher for close combat situations. Finally, the 'Mech carries a single C3 master computer. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The Battle Cobra makes use of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous technologies, but uses a standard Fusion Engine for increased durability. The primary weapon of the C configuration is an ATM 9, but it lack sufficient ammunition storage to make full use of the ATM technology. It is backed up by pulse lasers; two mediums and a small. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
Constructed using IS-grade Endo-Steel and clad in seven tons of Inner Sphere quality Ferro-Fibrous armor, the BTL-C-2O Battle Cobra mounts a lighter 200 rated standard fusion engine. While reducing its speed by 20 kph, the extra weight was required to carry heavier IS grade weapons as well as mount a fixed Improved C3 Computer in its center torso. The Prime is based on its Clan counterpart, carrying an IS-grade Large Pulse Laser in each arm as well as an extra double heat sink. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

The U loadout combines three ER PPC with two Medium Pulse Lasers and four ER Medium Lasers, all linked through a large six ton targeting computer. Due to its full energy loadout a total of 24 double heat sinks can just barely keep up with the cooling needed, assuming some constraint is kept from firing repeated alpha strikes. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: The Blue Flame's primary armament is two ER Large Lasers that allow the 'Mech to engage the enemy at long ranges. It also has three Streak SRM-2 launchers for close range combat. The 'Mech is built around a Endo Steel chassis that cradles a 225 Light Fusion engine that gives the 'Mech a top speed of 86.4 km/h. The Blue Flame carries an impressive eleven tons of armor and has ten double heat sinks. To allow the 'Mech to share targeting data with friendly units, it is equipped with an improved C3 computer that allows it to exchange information with other C3i equipped units Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The Cecerops ProtoMech was designed and built by Clan Blood Spirit using materials acquired from Clan Snow Raven. Though not as heavily armored as some other ProtoMechs, the design's high speed prevents most opponents from getting a target lock. The Cecerops is armed with a single ER Micro Laser. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

These features make it a flexible combatant, able to keep up with scout 'Mechs while supporting them. Developed during the 3060s, this variant utilizes then-newly developed Heavy Laser technology. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
Clan Nova Cat’s Conjurer program in the 3060s saw refits and various new builds at times only loosely based on the original. Some of them, like the Conjurer 6, had back-canted legs and weapon pod arms reliant on energy weapons. These served as foundation to the Hellcat, and inspired the Avalanche's upgrade to the Wendigo seventy years later on Avon. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Utilizing some of the newest technology available in the Capellan Confederation, the 7L was built by Tao 'Mechworks in 3067. It used Stealth Armor, making it harder to target. The 'Mech also used double heat sinks and is armed with two LRM-15 launchers, two Streak SRM-4 launchers, and two ER Medium Lasers. Finally, the 'Mech carried a Guardian ECM Suite to allow its Stealth Armor to work. In order to make room, the top speed was lowered to 53 km/h by replacing the engine with a Nissan Fusion 195, though jump jets offset that through increased maneuverability. Despite its Liao origins, half of the first production run was sold to the Word of Blake. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: Created in 3066 with the mindset of 'bigger is better', the -8S Crusader was built around an Endo Steel chassis and powered by an XL Engine. The 'Mech carried two LRM-10 launchers and two Medium Lasers but was also armed with the new Heavy Gauss Rifle, giving it great deal of close to medium range firepower. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original: The Delphyne was developed by Clan Blood Spirit and Clan Fire Mandrill. Basing the design on the lessons learned from producing the Minotaur, the Delphyne is one of the most effective heavy ProtoMechs. Carrying a 'Mech sized Medium Pulse Laser, the Delphyne packs a significant punch when used against light and medium 'Mechs, and a Point of them can threaten a heavy 'Mech. Quirk: Heavy ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original:
The FS9-C is an upgrade of the Firestarter manufactured by Coventry Metal Works for the Periphery starting in 3064. The armor has been upgraded to ferro-fibrous and the 'Mech carries two flamers, two medium lasers, two RL-15s, and four RL-10s, giving it an incredible one-shot kill capability against heavier 'Mechs. The already overwhelming number of Firestarters in the near Periphery led to the failure of this variant. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: One of the 'second generation' of Goliaths, the 3S's engine has been upgraded to a Light Fusion Engine, and, as a result, it now carries thirteen and an half tons of armor. The entire arsenal has been stripped from the 'Mech and the 3S carries as its primary weapon an LB-X Autocannon/20. This is backed up by three ER Medium Lasers. For longer-range engagements, the Goliath carries an LRM-10 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system as well as an ER Large Laser. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
The 7K variant first built in 3063 uses an Endo Steel chassis to free up weight and carries an XL Engine for power, which is linked to a MASC system. This allows the Grand Dragon to move at speeds of up to 129.6 km/h in short bursts. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC as its primary weapon. For support, the 'Mech carries an MRM-10 as its secondary weapon. The 'Mech also carries three ER Medium Lasers as close combat weapons, all of which are carried in the left arm to allow for the greatest range of fire. Finally, the 'Mech has a C3 slave unit that allows it to share targeting information with friendly units. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
Originally envisioned as a refresh to the GRN-D-02, the -03 introduced so many changes that a new chassis designation was needed. Dubbed the Grand Crusader II, the 'Mech is still built on an Endo Steel chassis, but now carries a much larger 320 light fusion engine to give it a top speed of 64.8 km/h and a much greater amount of survivability than the XL engine carried by earlier models. The 03 also carries Triple Strength Myomer to increase its ground speed to 86.4 km/h as long as it is running hot. The 'Mech has four jump jets to further increase its mobility. The variant carries fifteen tons of armor protection and is armed with two ER Large Lasers as its primary weapons, backed up by an LRM-15 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system. For close combat, the 'Mech has three ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 missile launcher. The 'Mech also carries an improved C3 computer, allowing it to share targeting data with friendly units. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Модель 04 была разработана как вариация 03 для дальнего боя, о чем можно судить по ее основному вооружению: легкой винтовке Гаусса и ER PPC, установленным в руках. Для ближнего боя мех имеет два средних лазера и ракетную установку Streak SRM-6. Мех также оснащен улучшенным блоком C3, как у модели 03, позволяющим ему обмениваться данными целеуказания с дружественными юнитами. Особенность: Стабильный Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.14

To provide additional mobility, the Great Turtle is equipped with three torso-mounted Jump Jets. These allow the Great Turtle to get out of sticky situations relatively quickly. content.original: The Capellans have rebuilt the Griffin from the skeleton up to take advantage of their new stealth armor. The engineers selected a XL fusion engine to allow for the larger LRM-15 launcher and Guardian ECM system; thirteen double-strength heat sinks are required to keep the design reasonably cool. Further upgrades include an Artemis IV targeting system to improve the accuracy of the missile rack and an ER PPC. Concerns about the fragility of using an XL engine was settled by allotting an additional 1.5 tons of armor. Finally, CASE protection for the ammunition bins was vital; while incapable of protecting the bulky engine, it allows the pilot to eject safely in the event of an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 3LL is an alternative to the 3L, replacing the ER PPC with a ER Large Laser. The savings in weight permits adding one double heat sink and an additional ton of armor. Range and damage would be reduced, but the added protection and ability to fire both main weapons while in stealth mode – with no chance of overheating – is too good to resist. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Griffin 6R is an early prototype of what would eventually become the 6S. However, since it uses Streak SRM rather than LRM launchers and mounts so many medium lasers without enough cooling, it was felt it strayed too far from the core concept of the Griffins, and was eventually rejected for mass production. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
During the Combine-Ghost Bear War, Star Captain Scott of the Gurdel Bloodhouse came to fame for his customized Grizzly that has reignited this failed design. A potent urban defender, Scott's loadout is now a standard, with old Grizzlies being recalled for refit. The variant keeps the Gauss Rifle, but swaps out the pulse lasers for an ER Large Laser and six ER Micro Lasers. The missile launcher is replaced with an ATM 9 and two tons of ammunition. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original:
Prototype Hellcat-Ps are identical to the current production iteration in nearly every aspect except for the engine. The heavier power plant's reduced top speed made it undesirable for many of Clan Jade Falcon's front-line light and medium Stars. It was soon relegated to solahma units. While there is demand to return to these under-engined specs by customers hoping for a bargain, discerning customers are instead referred to the standard model (for maximum profit via the XXL engine). Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Used by Word of Blake, the 5C variant of the Hermes II was introduced in 3062 and takes aspects of the 2M and 4K variants. The chassis has been upgraded to endo steel and the 'Mech is powered by an extralight engine. The primary weapon is an ER large laser in place of the AC/5, backed up with three ER medium lasers. Finally, the 5C carries an improved Narc missile beacon and an improved C3 computer to allow it to assist other friendly units in targeting enemy units. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: This variant uses an Endo Steel chassis and 300 rated XL Engine to save weight. The larger engine allows it to reach a top speed of 96km/h. It carries an ER Medium Laser in each arm and a single SRM-6 in the left torso. The main hitting power comes from an LB 20-X autocannon in the right torso. The SRM has a ton of ammunition, while the autocannon has two tons of ammo. It is protected by ten tons of armor and carries ten double heat sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: The Infiltrator Mk. II is a battle armor suit designed as a replacement for the earlier Infiltrator Mk. I. With better armament and protection than its predecessor, the Mk. II was superior in all ways except cost. A battle armor-scale Magshot rifle provides firepower while an anti-infantry SMG provides light defense. A suite of stealth armor keeps the suit protected on the field. The only serious downside is the slow ground speed of the Mk. II, though jump jets help keep the suit semi-mobile. Quirk: Stealth Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount any unit, can melee, can swarm.

The LRM-15 has been completely removed from the ‘Mech and replaced with two Streak SRM-4s. content.original: Custom built from discarded Locust wrecks, the Koto is a 25 ton mech built exclusively for the Solaris 7 arenas by Omnitech Industries. Sharing the same basic shape as it's parent design the Koto is extensively rebuilt with an Endo Steel skeleton, Ferro-Fibrous armour, double heat sinks and an XL Engine. Weighing 5 tons heavier then the Locust, the Koto has a significantly heavier weapons array; built for annihilating opponents in the arena. The Koto 3A is armed with a Large Pulse Laser, 2 Medium Lasers and a Small Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
This short-lived version was the prototype for the MTR-6K. Its equipment, heat sinks, and armor configuration is identical to the -6K variant. The weapon configuration tested showed that the ER Large Laser and ER PPC would quickly overwhelm the reduced cooling system, which led to the downrated weapons used on the -6K. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original:
This scout version designed by Telfar BattleMechs and also produced by Norse-Storm BattleMechs has seen limited success. It adds a Beagle Active Probe and Guardian ECM Suite. In order to make way for them, two heat sinks were removed and the pulse lasers were downgraded to standard Medium Lasers. A pair of Small Lasers were added to make up for the lost firepower, but the lost accuracy is sorely missed. Since the loss of heat sinks put the Maelstrom in danger of building heat, the extended range weapons were downgraded to a Large Laser and PPC respectively. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: The MCY-102 is an upgrade to the Mercury introduced in 3067 by the Word of Blake. This variant retains the engine, MASC, and armor of the MCY-99 but carries two major modifications. The first is the rebuilding of the chassis using Endo Steel. The change in the chassis construction and removal of one small and one medium laser allows for the second modification: the installation of an Improved C3 Computer, making it capable of operating with five other units in a C3i unit. Both of the remaining lasers were also changed out for extended range models. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

This variation of the Minotaur was redesigned as a fire support model, armed with an LRM 12 Launcher as its 'main gun'. content.original:
The so-called Nexus II takes the best of the Nexus B variant, the NXS2-A adds to that a Vox-LE 200 Light Fusion Engine that gives the 'Mech a top speed of 129.6 km/h well boasting and increase to three and a half tons of standard armor. The 'Mech is armed with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Medium Lasers, two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Small Lasers, and is equipped with an Improved C3 unit identical to the one in the NXS1-B. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original:
Considered the progenitor of the Nexus II, the NXS1-B variant of the standard NXS1-A intended to make the 'Mech more capable as a recon unit, the B variant completely restructures the 'Mechs arsenal and reworks the Nexus into a powerful scout 'Mech. Clad in four tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the NXS1-B is capable of jumping up to one hundred and fifty meters and carries two ER Medium Lasers as its primary weapons. These are backed up by an ER Small Laser. What makes this Nexus variant so effective as a recon 'Mech is its Improved C3 unit that allows it to share targeting data with up to five allied units. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The 2M is another upgrade of the Orion using Star League technology. Built in 3063 the 'Mech uses an Endo Steel chassis and utilizes ten double-strength heat sinks to save weight and for their greater heat-dissipation ability. For long-range combat, the ON2-M is armed with a Gauss Rifle as well as an LRM-15 linked to an Artemis IV FCS for increased accuracy. For closer ranges, the 'Mech has three medium pulse lasers. The ON2-M is armored with twelve and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: The 4Z variant of the Pillager is built to provide an almost perfect long range sniper 'Mech. The new Stealth armor makes it harder to hit, as does the required Guardian ECM Suite. In order to do fit these changes, the 'Mech has had two medium lasers and the Large Laser removed. The remaining medium lasers have been upgraded to ER medium lasers. The Pillager has also replaced the XL engine with a standard engine and added CASE for more reliability, so the 'Mech can survive a side torso destruction. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

The Purifier Adaptive is revolutionary in that it uses mimetic, color-shifting armor. The Mimetic Armor makes the Purifier Adaptive much more difficult to target, especially when it is motionless. The drawback comes in the amount of armor it carries. Quirk: Mimetic Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.872 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

The drawback comes in the amount of armor it carries. Особенность: Адаптивный Множитель стоимости высадки: 0.872 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The 8K variant of the Quickdraw brings it up to 3062 weapons standards. The 'Mech is built using an endo steel chassis and is armored with eight and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor. The 'Mech's arsenal has also been stripped and upgraded, carrying four forward-mounted ER medium lasers and an MRM-30 launcher, a compromise between the LRMs and SRMs of past models, supplied by two tons of ammunition. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original:
The first of the Raijin II designs, the 200-A model completely redesigns the 'Mech to enhance its combat capabilities and is built on an Endo Steel chassis to save weight. Increased ground speed is achieved through the use of Triple Strength Myomers that increases the 'Mech's top speed to 118.8 km/h under the proper conditions. The 200-A model is protected by a respectable eleven tons of standard armor; giving it superior armor protection to older models. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC as its primary weapon. This is supported by three ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-4 launcher for close combat. The RJN-200-A also carries a C3i Computer, allowing it to share targeting data with friendly units. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Intended to act as a heavy scout, the 200-B uses the 200-A as its base. The 'Mech has Stealth Armor that makes it extremely hard to hit when activated and carries the ECM suite that is needed with any stealth armor system. The 'Mech also has a TAG laser designator, a Beagle Active Probe, and an improved C3 system. The only drawback to all of the advanced electronics is that when the stealth armor is activated the 'Mech is subject to its own ECM system, effectively blocking its own improved C3 system. The 200-B carries four ER Medium Lasers and an ER Small Laser to defend itself. Additionally, to increase its survivability, the 200-B uses a light fusion engine. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The 200-C takes the concept of the 101-A and the 200-B and combines the best of them making an agile, long-range sniper 'Mech that is extremely hard to hit. This is done by combining the light fusion engine, Stealth Armor and ECM suite of the 200-B model with the armament and Triple Strength Myomer of the 200-A model. The 200-C is armed with an ER PPC for long range combat which is backed up by two ER Medium Lasers. The 'Mech is also linked to an improved C3 network, making it one of the most impressive sniper 'Mechs. However, it should be noted that its stealth armor interferes with the C3 network while active, requiring the pilot to choose between improved accuracy or stealth. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A greatly improved version of the Raijin, the C model turns the 'Mech into a powerful close range brawler. This necessitated that the 'Mech's entire arsenal be stripped and replaced, as well as the addition of one and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech's primary weapon is a Large Pulse Laser, backed up by three ER Medium Lasers, and a Streak SRM-6. Finally, the 'Mech also incorporates an improved C3 system that allows it to provide targeting data to friendly units. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

Roc 2 main gun was exchanged for a Heavy Medium Laser. To accommodate the new weapon, armor protection was reduced. Quirk: Heavy ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9

content.original: Designed as a fast foot scout for battle armor units, the Rottweiler pushes the envelope of what ground speed battle armor can reach. Clad in BA-grade stealth armor and equipped with ECM, the Rottweiler makes for a hard target. However, this speed and evasiveness comes with a price: the Rottweiler is lightly armed. Each suit carries a Small Laser as primary armament and carries a Firedrake incendiary needler as a backup weapon. While not a lot of firepower, it was judged to be acceptable by the Lyran Alliance and the suit was put into production. Quirk: Stealth Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can only mount internal bays, can not melee, can not swarm.

content.original: The Satyr ProtoMech was designed to serve as a deep raider and reconnaissance unit. Offering only slightly more protection than a Harpy or Siren, the Satyr's best defense is to remain hidden from enemy units. First introduced during the 3060s, this variant drops the original weaponry for an increase in mobility with the addition of Jump Jets and increased armor. Leftover weight allowed the Satyr 2 to mount a single Micro Pulse Laser. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

This configuration focuses on long-range combat with an ER PPC, a pair of ER Large Lasers, and two ATM 9s that carry enough ammunition to be effective at all ranges. Three ER Medium Lasers provide medium to close range support, while a Targeting Computer aids the accuracy of all the energy weapons. Three jump jets give the 'Mech some extra maneuverability. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: One of the first mass production QuadMechs, the 55 ton Scorpion entered production in 2570 as an infantry support unit. Shunned by most MechWarriors due to it's notoriously unstable gait, the Scorpion would nevertheless see uninterrupted use throughout the Succession Wars and beyond. The Scorpion 12C is powered by a 330 rated XL Engine giving it a top speed of 97km/h. An ER PPC, iNARC and an ER Small Laser form the Mechs weapons load. A C3i module allows the Mech to share data with other C3i equipped Mechs. Quirk: Quad Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Siren ProtoMech was originally designed by Clan Smoke Jaguar to serve as a reconnaissance unit. Its high speed allowed it to rush forward, find enemy forces, call in a missile strike, and evacuate without the enemy being able to see them. This variant was armed with a pair of SRM-1 Launchers. To fit the large weapons, the Siren's speed was reduced to 120 km/h. Quirk: Light ProtoMech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

content.original:
In preparation for a rumored technology exchange with Norse-Storm Technologies, which hopes to equip its own Spectors with Capellan stealth armor, Shengli Arms acquired several examples of the 'Mech with an eye towards developing their own version. Using recent advances in battle suit mimetic armor technology, they built the SPR-7L, a truly stealthy 'Mech tailored to cover a wide variety of missions. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The 7K is an upgrade of the base design, introduced by Nimakachi in 3067 and based on the success of other revitalized classic designs. It's built using an Endo Steel structure and five and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, a Light Fusion Engine in place of the standard model, and carries two Medium Pulse Lasers. Perhaps most critically, Nimakachi was able to finally install an ejection system in the 7K. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original:
Irian’s attempt to make up for the shortcomings of the 5M, the 6M introduced in 3062 drops the SRMs and Narc entirely, upgrades the LRMs to 15-tube racks with integral Artemis IV FCS and three tons of reloads each, and upgrades the lasers to ER versions, mounting a fifth medium. Most importantly, the LRM magazines are now protected with CASE. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

Irian’s attempt to make up for the shortcomings of the 5M, the 6M introduced in 3062 drops the SRMs and Narc entirely, upgrades the LRMs to 15-tube racks with integral Artemis IV FCS and three tons of reloads each, and upgrades the lasers to ER versions, mounting a fifth medium. Most importantly, the LRM magazines are now protected with CASE. Особенность: Боевой компьютер Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.15

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The 7D Stalker introduced by the Federated Suns in 3062 is built on a standard chassis and engine for rugged durability and carries a primarily energy arsenal. Its two primary weapons are two ER PPCs, giving the 7D a striking distance out to just under seven hundred meters. The 'Mech is also armed with four Medium Pulse Lasers for close combat, which are backed up by two Streak SRM-4 launchers to take advantage of any weak points in an enemy's armor. The lasers and ER PPCs are all linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, which gives the 7D extreme accuracy. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
Introduced by the Lyran Alliance in 3064, the STK-8S is built around a new Light Fusion Engine which frees up some tonnage for heavier weapons. The 8S is armed with two ER PPCs for long-range combat. When it closes with an enemy it can bring its new Heavy Gauss Rifle to bear at intermediate to short ranges. Finally, for short range combat, the 8S carries two Medium Pulse Lasers and two ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Changes in the way the Clans fight since they made contact with the Inner Sphere led scientists from Clan Steel Viper to revisit the Vapor Eagle. They stripped out all the weaponry, but left everything else alone. This variant is effective at long range, as it mounts a Clan Mk. XVII ER PPC. The Fang Series-A ATM 3 replaced the Machine Guns of the original, though it only mounts one ton of ammunition, so the launcher loses the all-important flexibility of the Advanced Tactical Missile System. For close range, three Series 5K Heavy Medium Lasers provide a powerful punch, while a pair of Pattern D-II SRM-2 launchers add more damage potential. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
The 4L Vindicator is a major upgrade to the design, part of Ceres Metals' efforts to revive the line in 3063. The engine has been replaced with a 225-rated XL engine, granting the 'Mech a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and its jumping distance was increased to 150 meters with an additional jump jet. The 'Mech uses double heat sinks for its advanced weapons load, which includes an ER PPC and LRM-5 for striking power at long range and an ER medium laser and medium pulse laser for short range work. Finally, the 'Mech carries a Guardian ECM Suite and is protected with nine tons of Stealth Armor, making it harder to target at range. The 4L became a common design among Shadow Lances following their introduction. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Void is a battle armor design that is produced by the Draconis Combine. The Void is protected by stealth armor and is a fairly mobile jump-capable battle armor. Armed with a single Support PPC, the Void is capable of moderate suppressing fire against larger targets. The stealth armor ensures it takes minimal return fire and the Support PPC guarantees the Void is useful on most battlefields. Quirk: Void Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

content.original: The 8C variant of the Wolverine, introduced by Victory Industries in 3067 after the success of the 8K, is built on an Endo Steel chassis and uses an XL Engine for power. It carries a large pulse laser as its primary weapon, as well as a medium pulse laser and a small pulse laser. For additional close-combat capability this version carries two Streak SRM-6 launchers while a C3 Slave Unit allows it to share targeting telemetry with friendly units but only carries thirteen double heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 8D Wolverine is an one of two updated versions introduced by Kallon in 3066 that incorporates some of the newest equipment to the AFFS. The 'Mech is built with an Endo Steel chassis and uses an XL engine augmented with MASC, enabling speeds of up to 108 km/h. Its main gun is a Rotary Autocannon/2, backed up by an ER Medium Laser and a Streak SRM-6 launcher. Both the Rotary Autocannon and the ER Medium Laser are linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, making the Wolverine extremely accurate. However the design carries only ten double heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 8K Wolverine was first introduced for the Combine in 3064 when Victory Industries decided to update the design. It is built using an XL engine for power and uses fifteen double heat sinks for its high heat load. This variant carries a ER PPC backed up by an ER Medium Laser, both in the right arm, and a Medium Pulse Laser in the head. Finally, to exploit any weak points in an enemy's armor, the 'Mech carries a Streak SRM-6 launcher in the left torso along with one ton of ammo. Twelve tons of armor with CASE provide additional protection. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 9D Wolverine is the companion of the 8D and shares some similarities, such as the Endo Steel chassis and the XL engine. First fielded at the same time as the 8D the 'Mech carries, as its main weapon, a Rotary Autocannon/2 backed up by two medium pulse lasers and a Streak SRM-6 launcher. It also carries a TAG laser designator, to designate targets for Arrow IV artillery attacks. Unlike the 8D, this variant does not jump, though it does retain the MASC and has twelve double heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The Wraith marked Curtiss Militech's entry into BattleMech production. When the design was announced, many felt that the design would be little more than a walking water cooler. What the critics got was a shock. The Wraith is a 'Mech that, when properly employed, can wreak havoc on an enemy with its astounding speed and maneuverability. It is built around a massive LTV 385 XL Engine that allows it to reach speeds of just under 119 kph. The Wraith has a simple, yet effective, pulse weapons payload. Pulse laser weaponry allows the Mech to negate most of the side effects on accuracy that are introduced by the Wraith's heavy use of jump jets, making it incredibly accurate and powerful for such a lightly armed Mech. A modification of the Wraith made by the Word of Blake, the TR3 replaces the two Medium Pulse Lasers with two ER Medium Lasers while one of the jump jets is removed to make room for an improved C3 computer, making the Wraith an incredibly powerful point 'Mech for units equipped with C3i equipment. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: The 6D Hatchetman is a variant with a decidedly Davion flair. Created by Johnston Industries in 3062 the 6D is powered by a 225 extralight engine that propels the 'Mech up to speeds of up to 86.4 km/h and can jump up to 150 meters thanks to an extra jump jet. The 'Mech is armed with a RAC/5 as its primary weapon backed up by a trio of ER Medium Lasers and, for protection against electronic warfare systems, it has a Guardian ECM Suite. Finally the 6D is protected by nine tons of armor and mounts ten double heat sinks. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: If you see a Hatchetman running at full speed towards you, brace for heavy impact. Their melee attacks are nothing to ignore, even for much heavier 'Mechs.

content.original: Created during the FedCom Civil War in 3064 by Defiance Industries, the 6S replaces the XL Engine of the 5S with a Light Engine. The pulse lasers are replaced with ER models and the heat sink are upgraded to double-strength versions. In addition, the magazine for the autocannon is doubled. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: This modification of the Nightsky intended to make the 'Mech more durable and gave it a longer life on the battlefield. The 'Mech replaces the 300-rated XL engine with a 300 light fusion engine. The 'Mech also removes all of its ranged weaponry and replaces it with seven ER medium lasers. When combined with the hatchet, the 'Mech is a monster, both against battle armor and in an urban environment. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: The Nightsky is the succesor to the Hatchetman and Axeman developed by Defiance Industries. As with its predecessors, the centerpiece of the Nightsky is a massive four-ton hatchet that is built into its right arm, which allows the 'Mech to cut through another 'Mech's armor.

content.original: This variant of the Nightsky uses Triple Strength Myomer to maximize physical attack damage. It also uses one ER medium laser and a pair of ER small lasers. To make room for those weapons, it loses a medium pulse laser. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: This modification of the Nightsky intended to make the 'Mech more durable and gave it a longer life on the battlefield. The 'Mech replaces the 300-rated XL engine with a 300 light fusion engine. The 'Mech also removes all of its ranged weaponry and replaces it with seven ER medium lasers. When combined with the hatchet, the 'Mech is a monster, both against battle armor and in an urban environment. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: This Experimental prototype Tukogawa MBT began its development by Buda Imperial Vehicles on Luthien in 3067. The one-off vehicle was almost lost when Luthien fell into chaos with the dawn of the Jihad, and the supervising Technician, Roald Vu, was killed. During the recovery process in mid-3070s, the prototype was rediscovered. The DCMS decided to use this vehicle as testbed for new type of LRM launcher. The vehicle is fitted with a turreted mounted 15-tubed Extended Long Range Missile Launcher, with 2 tons of ammo. Co-axed with the launcher is a Class 10 Hyper-Velocity Autocannon with two tons of ammunition. To make room for these weapons, the vehicle's engine was changed out for a 280 Rated XXL Fusion Engine. The new engine propelled the vehicle up to 80 km/h. To protect the fragile engine, the hull was given 8.5 tons worth of Clan Ferro Fibrous Armor. A C3 Slave Computer is fitted to allow lancemates to coordinate fire against enemy forces. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 280 30 Left 220 30 Right 220 30 Rear 195 30 Turret 220 30 Total 1135 150 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

content.original: A custom BNC-5S piloted by Solaris VII duelist Victor Vandergriff during the Solaris riots of 3062. The weapon loadout in this variant is similar to a standard BNC-5S. Two ER PPCs are the main armaments, one mounted in the left arm and the other in the right torso. A LB-10X sits in the left torso. The two medium lasers of the original are retained in the left arm. The right arm contains a small SRM-4. Finally, four Luxor jump jets are added for increased mobility. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original: The Blue Flame began production after the Word of Blake took possession of Terra. The same factory that had produced the Shootist was upgraded to produce four legged BattleMechs. The Blue Flame is an extremely stable platform due to its quadrupedal configuration. In the later years of the Jihad, an engineer who had help build the Mech stole the design specs and later created the Thunder Fox.

Carrying thirteen tons of ferro-fibrous armor, the Mad Cat MK II is an incredibly resilient design. A pair of arm mounted Gaussrifles supported by torso mounted LRM racks give it complete command over the battlefield.

content.original:
Piloted by Mark Kisomita during the Jihad, this customized model was refitted with post-Clan Invasion technology. Initially upgraded to the 7K standard, the use of Ferro-Fibrous armor and a Light Engine saves weight, while the LRM-15 is retained the standard medium is swapped for a single ER Medium while the prototype ER Large is replaced with a Heavy PPC. A C3 Slave Unit and MASC enhances its abilities in combat. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Grand Dragon is the successful follow-up to the Dragon BattleMech. Just like the Dragon, the Grand Dragon quickly became a favorite in the DCMS, with nearly every line unit fielding a company of either design. Production of the Grand Dragon continued unabated until the Jihad, when the Word of Blake devastated LAW's factories in 3068. It took two years for LAW to get new Grand Dragon factories up and running, the first on Nykvarn followed by Abiy Adi and Savinsville, and ensure the continued use of the 'Mech in years to come.

content.original:
Jointly developed by the Federated Commonwealth and the Draconis Combine, the 85 ton Gunslinger entered production in 3053. Powered by a 255 rated XL Engine, the customised Gunslinger 1ERD-Jared is armed with a pair of LRM-15’s. 4 Medium Lasers, a pair of Streak SRM-4’s and a Small Laser add additional fire power at close ranges. A Guardian ECM Suite and a Beagle Active Probe enhance the Mechs capabilities. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: This failed experimental variant of the Hunchback was developed by Kali Yama Weapons Industries. Only four prototypes were produced in 3065, but no orders were placed for it. This experimental version of the 'Mech included CASE II, a Torso-Mounted Cockpit, Heavy Gyro, and was built using a Reinforced Structure. The 'Mech was protected by 9 tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor, and its armored and reinforced components enhanced its battlefield survivability. It was armed with a single Class 10 Ultra Autocannon carrying two tons of ammo. However, the design was considered too expensive for the reduction in firepower. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The Hunchback C is the antithesis of the Hunchback IIC used by other Clans, combining toughness and great ground speed with the heavy firepower of its autocannon. Piloted by Star Commander Matthew Wayne, of the Clan Ghost Bear's Seventh Phalanx. Disgraced after losing his OmniMech and from an insignificant Bloodhouse, he saw it as his only resort to take charge of a Hunchback of Lyran origins. However, heavy modifications to the 'Mech and his unrelenting desire to redeem himself led to him eventually being adopted by Delta Galaxy's Seventy-Third Battle Cluster, before he finally was killed while clearing Blakists during a glorious charge at Fell's Fort. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

content.original: A rivalry between two lesser Solaris stables beget the prototype Huron Warrior nicknamed the ’Thunderchief.’ While the original was made almost entirely from, illegibly, stolen parts; the few knock-offs and reproductions that have filtered throughout the Inner Sphere have solidified this unusual design. The Thunderchief is primarily built around a Thumper Artillery cannon which used to pummel targets at range and a hatchet used for in-close work. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Defensively the Fury trades speed for armor, mounting an 280 rated XL engine to carry four and half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

content.original:
Refitted prior to the Jihad, the prototype chassis and armor of Grace's Jenner were swapped for now refined production grade components. While retaining the Narc Missile Beacon, dropping its ammo to a single ton along with the removal of her 'Mech's jump jets allowed it to replace the two Medium Lasers with a pair of Light PPCs and add a C3 Slave Unit to enhance her spotter role. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
This version is built with Clan technology similar to the Marauder II C. It uses a standard 300 rated Fusion Engine with sixteen tons of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel internal structure. It is armed with an ER PPC and two Medium Pulse Lasers in each arm. A Gauss Rifle sits in the right torso with two tons of ammunition, and a Targeting Computer is in the left torso for increased accuracy. It has a Clan-tech CASE system to protect the Gauss Rifle, and can jump 90 meters at a time. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.31

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Piranha Hero 'Mech, the Cipher carries three Machine Guns and three ER Micro Lasers in each side torso supported by a single Heavy Medium Laser in each arm and a center torso ER Small Laser. Carrying two tons of machine gun ammunition and ten double heat sinks, the Cipher is built on an 180 XL engine, an Endo Steel frame and is covered by just three tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: It is uncertain who first built this heavily customized Quickdraw, very little remains of the original -8K it was based on. However, it is said the name of Death Incarnate is double edged. According to the rumours often heard in the mess hall late at night, whoever rides the 'Mech into battle always ended up dead under seemingly natural causes, but only after killing a great number of foes. It is most likely just the typical drunk MechWarrior tales, but some might still refuse to pilot it.

content.original:
A Draconis Combine developed Omni mech, the Sunder is based on reverse engineered Loki and Thor Omnimechs. A 360 rated XL Engine allows the omnimech to carry 15 DHS along with 16.5 tons of armor and 36 tons of weapons. The Sunder SD1-O (Samual) is designed to engage infantry, with a single ER PPC retained to fight at range. 3 SRM-4’s and a pair of SRM-6’s are loaded with inferno rounds, whilst 5 Flamers and a pair of MG Arrays are used for close range fighting. A pair of B-Pods round out the configuration. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Despite the dark cloud of graft looming over the Valkyrie II project, the Steiner and Davion stables of Solaris VII quickly jumped at the opportunity to get their hands on the heavily armored and incredibly fast Valkyrie II chassis for retrofitting into gladiatorial designs. 'Hildr' is one such design fitted with a BattleMech Mace, capable of crushing armor and internal components in one blow, and a Snub-Nose PPC to finish off anything strong enough to be standing after its assaults. Quirk: Integrated TSM Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08
content.prevOriginal: Despite the dark cloud of graft looming over the Valkyrie II project, the Steiner and Davion stables of Solaris VII quickly jumped at the opportunity to get their hands on the heavily armored and incredibly fast Valkyrie II chassis for retrofitting into gladiatorial designs. 'Hildr' is one such design fitted with a BattleMech Mace, capable of crushing armor and internal components in one blow, and a Snub-Nose PPC to finish off anything strong enough to be standing after its assualts. Quirk: Integrated TSM Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08
content.content: Несмотря на темное облако, нависшее над проектом Valkyrie II, стороны Steiner и Davion из Solaris VII быстро ухватились за возможность получить в свои руки тяжелобронированное и невероятно быстрое шасси Valkyrie II для переоборудования в гладиаторские конструкции. Hildr - одна из таких конструкций, оснащенная булавой, способной одним ударом сокрушить броню и внутренние компоненты, и Snub-Nose PPC, чтобы добить все, что устоит после его атак. Особенность: Встроенный TSM Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.08

'Hildr' here has been a terror in the Solaris arenas, leaving many opponents crushed with that mace or slagged with the Snub-Nosed PPC in the left hand.

content.original: Boss, this beauty is one of those Valkyrie IIs from the Solaris stables; I've seen these in action. 'Sigrun' here has a BattleMech Sword and TSM allowing it to cleave limbs clean off many 'Mechs. Her left-hook is also pretty damn brutal with that Plasma Cannon. Roll that all together with that monstrous engine and six jump jets, this 'Mech can chase down and murder most 'Mechs.
content.prevOriginal: Boss, this beauty is one of those Valkyrie IIs from the Solaris stables; I've seen these in action. Roll that all together with that mostrous engine and six jump jets, this 'Mech can chase down and murder most 'Mechs.
content.content: Босс, эта красавица - одна из тех Валькирий II из ангаров Solaris; я видел их в действии. У «Сигрун» есть меч и TSM, позволяющий ей отрубать конечности многим мехам. Ее левый крюк также чертовски брутален с этой плазменной пушкой. Если сложить все это вместе с чудовищным двигателем и шестью прыжковыми двигателями, то этот мех может преследовать и убивать большинство мехов.

content.original:
Personal 'Mech of Daniel Allard, commander of the Kell Hounds mercenary unit. With close ties to Clan Wolf-in-Exile, this Wolfhound was built in 3062 using Clan technology. It includes a Clan extralight engine, twelve double heat sinks and Clan weaponry: an ER PPC in the right arm and three ER medium lasers split between the torso, while the rear-center torso mounts an ER small laser. All of these weapons are tied to a Targeting Computer for superior accuracy. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: This Experimental prototype Tukogawa MBT began its development by Buda Imperial Vehicles on Luthien in 3067. The one-off vehicle was almost lost when Luthien fell into chaos with the dawn of the Jihad, and the supervising Technician, Roald Vu, was killed. During the recovery process in mid-3070s, the prototype was rediscovered. The DCMS decided to use this vehicle as testbed for new type of LRM launcher. The vehicle is fitted with a turreted mounted 15-tubed Extended Long Range Missile Launcher, with 2 tons of ammo. Co-axed with the launcher is a Class 10 Hyper-Velocity Autocannon with two tons of ammunition. To make room for these weapons, the vehicle's engine was changed out for a 280 Rated XXL Fusion Engine. The new engine propelled the vehicle up to 80 km/h. To protect the fragile engine, the hull was given 8.5 tons worth of Clan Ferro Fibrous Armor. A C3 Slave Computer is fitted to allow lancemates to coordinate fire against enemy forces. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 5/8 Hex: 150/240 Meters. Armor: Ferro-Fibrous (C) Structure: Structure Values A S Front 280 30 Left 220 30 Right 220 30 Rear 195 30 Turret 220 30 Total 1135 150 Quirk: Enhanced FPE

content.original: A custom BNC-5S piloted by Solaris VII duelist Victor Vandergriff during the Solaris riots of 3062. The weapon loadout in this variant is similar to a standard BNC-5S. Two ER PPCs are the main armaments, one mounted in the left arm and the other in the right torso. A LB-10X sits in the left torso. The two medium lasers of the original are retained in the left arm. content.original: This failed experimental variant of the Hunchback was developed by Kali Yama Weapons Industries. Only four prototypes were produced in 3065, but no orders were placed for it. This experimental version of the 'Mech included CASE II, a Torso-Mounted Cockpit, Heavy Gyro, and was built using a Reinforced Structure. The 'Mech was protected by 9 tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor, and its armored and reinforced components enhanced its battlefield survivability. It was armed with a single Class 10 Ultra Autocannon carrying two tons of ammo. However, the design was considered too expensive for the reduction in firepower. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The Hunchback C is the antithesis of the Hunchback IIC used by other Clans, combining toughness and great ground speed with the heavy firepower of its autocannon. Piloted by Star Commander Matthew Wayne, of the Clan Ghost Bear's Seventh Phalanx. Disgraced after losing his OmniMech and from an insignificant Bloodhouse, he saw it as his only resort to take charge of a Hunchback of Lyran origins. However, heavy modifications to the 'Mech and his unrelenting desire to redeem himself led to him eventually being adopted by Delta Galaxy's Seventy-Third Battle Cluster, before he finally was killed while clearing Blakists during a glorious charge at Fell's Fort. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

content.original: A rivalry between two lesser Solaris stables beget the prototype Huron Warrior nicknamed the ’Thunderchief.’ While the original was made almost entirely from, illegibly, stolen parts; the few knock-offs and reproductions that have filtered throughout the Inner Sphere have solidified this unusual design. The Thunderchief is primarily built around a Thumper Artillery cannon which used to pummel targets at range and a hatchet used for in-close work. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original:
A Draconis Combine developed Omni mech, the Sunder is based on reverse engineered Loki and Thor Omnimechs. A 360 rated XL Engine allows the omnimech to carry 15 DHS along with 16.5 tons of armor and 36 tons of weapons. The Sunder SD1-O (Samual) is designed to engage infantry, with a single ER PPC retained to fight at range. 3 SRM-4’s and a pair of SRM-6’s are loaded with inferno rounds, whilst 5 Flamers and a pair of MG Arrays are used for close range fighting. A pair of B-Pods round out the configuration. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Sunder SD1-O (Samual) предназначен для борьбы с пехотой, а для ведения боя на дистанции используется один ER PPC. 3 SRM-4 и пара SRM-6 заряжены инферно снарядами, а 5 Flamer и пара MG Arrays используются для ближнего боя. Пара B-Pods завершают конфигурацию. Особенность: Расширенный поворот торса Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.16

content.original: Despite the dark cloud of graft looming over the Valkyrie II project, the Steiner and Davion stables of Solaris VII quickly jumped at the opportunity to get their hands on the heavily armored and incredibly fast Valkyrie II chassis for retrofitting into gladiatorial designs. 'Hildr' is one such design fitted with a BattleMech Mace, capable of crushing armor and internal components in one blow, and a Snub-Nose PPC to finish off anything strong enough to be standing after its assaults. Quirk: Integrated TSM Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08
content.prevOriginal: Despite the dark cloud of graft looming over the Valkyrie II project, the Steiner and Davion stables of Solaris VII quickly jumped at the opportunity to get their hands on the heavily armored and incredibly fast Valkyrie II chassis for retrofitting into gladiatorial designs. content.content: Несмотря на темное облако, нависшее над проектом Valkyrie II, стороны Steiner и Davion из Solaris VII быстро ухватились за возможность получить в свои руки тяжелобронированное и невероятно быстрое шасси Valkyrie II для переоборудования в гладиаторские конструкции. Hildr - одна из таких конструкций, оснащенная булавой, способной одним ударом сокрушить броню и внутренние компоненты, и Snub-Nose PPC, чтобы добить все, что устоит после его атак. Особенность: Встроенный TSM Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.08

content.original: An upgrade of the Cyclops that has come out of the Periphery, the 11-H was first sighted in 3064 among the ranks of Lady Death's pirates. The H is built on the standard 10-Z chassis but now carries eleven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor and its weapons payload is heavily modified, carrying the standard Autocannon/20 and two medium lasers but replacing the rest for six Rocket Launcher 20s. This gives the 11-H the firepower to decimate anything that dares to close with it to attempt to make a kill. Quirk: Battle Computer B2000 Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: Named for the eight-legged horse ridden by the Norse god Odin, the Sleipnir is piloted by Ariana Winston of the Eridani Light Horse. Based of a CP-11-B, but built around a 360 XL Engine and Endo Steel frame, Sleipnir is armed with a Gauss Rifle in each side torso, a SRM-4 in the center torso and a Medium Laser in each arm and the head. Carrying four tons of Gauss rounds and a single ton of SRM missiles, Sleipnir mounts fifteen Double Heat Sinks with the remaining weight used on armor. Quirk: Battle Computer B2000 Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original:
Using the newest technology available at the end of the FedCom Civil War, a 300 rated Light Fusion Engine gives the -1P average speed for an assault 'Mech. A Rotary AC/2 and Rotary AC/5 in each arm provides devastating firepower, in the event the 2 tons of RAC/2 and 3 tons of RAC/5 ammo run dry, 4 Medium Lasers split among the side torsos and a center torso-mounted Snub-Nose PPC allows the -1P to continue providing fire support. 16 double heat sinks provide adequate dissipation. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Still a fearsome and powerful design, where the original Annihilator-1A carries a bevy of powerful autocannons, the -1E instead opts for an all-energy weapon loadout. Four Particle Projection Cannons give the Annihilator-1E a brutal and incredibly powerful punch while the Medium Lasers from the -1A are carried over for in-close protection while increasing the armor protection somewhat to mitigate enemy return fire.

content.original: The 6S variant of the Archer was built in 3067 by Bowie Industries using a new Light Fusion Engine, which weighed three quarters of the mass of the original engine. The 'Mech carried two LRM-20 launchers linked to an Artemis IV fire control system, two Streak SRM-2 launchers, and two medium Lasers for close combat. As a defensive measure, the 'Mech had an ER Small Laser mounted in the rear of its head. The variant carried six tons of ammo for the LRM and two tons for the SRM, all of which were protected by CASE. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Built for the Capellan Confederation by Earthwerks in 3067, the 7L variant of the Archer incorporated new Stealth Armor and a Guardian ECM Suite for protection against enemy electronics in addition to making the Archer harder to target. The 'Mech carried twelve and a half tons of Stealth Armor and was armed with two LRM-20 launchers and two ER Medium Lasers. The trade-off for this massive upgrade was that the 'Mech's top speed was reduced to 54 km/h. In an attempt to compensate for this, the 'Mech also had three jump jets mounted, making it capable of jumping up to ninety meters at a time. The 7L was slated to enter the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces' new Shadow Lances. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The 8M variant of the Archer was built on an Endo Steel chassis and mixed elements of several past variants. Introduced in 3067 by Earthwerks for the Word of Blake Militia, this variant was armed with two Delta Dart LRM-15 launchers linked to Artemis IV fire control systems in either side torso and an Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Laser in the center torso for long-range combat. It also mounted three Diverse Optics Sunfire ER Medium Lasers for short ranged support, one in each arm and the third in its head. This made the 8M effective at all ranges and gave it both long-range direct and indirect capabilities. The 8M was protected by thirteen and a half tons of Maximilian 100 standard armor which was better slopped in order to deflect weapons fire more easily. It carried twelve double heat sinks, and had a similar speed profile to the original Archer. Its upper body traversing assembly was improved over the original to better protect its hip actuators and its feet were redesigned to make it a more stable firing platform, whether standing or on the move. Four tons of LRM reloads were split between the side torsos and were protected by CASE. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

It also mounted three Diverse Optics Sunfire ER Medium Lasers for short ranged support, one in each arm and the third in its head. This made the 8M effective at all ranges and gave it both long-range direct and indirect capabilities. The 8M was protected by thirteen and a half tons of Maximilian 100 standard armor which was better slopped in order to deflect weapons fire more easily. It carried twelve double heat sinks, and had a similar speed profile to the original Archer. Its upper body traversing assembly was improved over the original to better protect its hip actuators and its feet were redesigned to make it a more stable firing platform, whether standing or on the move. Four tons of LRM reloads were split between the side torsos and were protected by CASE. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The C 2 is a full conversion of the earlier Archer C design to clan-based technology, from the chassis up instead of just the weapons. The two LRM-20 launchers are kept, but upgraded with attached Artemis IV Fire Control Systems to provide excellent long range indirect fire capabilities. Two Medium Pulse Lasers and two Streak SRM-4 launchers allows the 'Mech to still deal with closer range targets in a sufficient manner. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original:
A vicious anti-infantry variant, the origin of the Flea "Fire Ant" is a mystery, with Earthwerks denying the design. It was first seen in the Chaos March, most notably in urban fighting on Carver V, in 3063 and none were spotted after 3068. Possibly the predecessor to the 19 and 20, the exact configuration is not known (if one even exists, as it seems to be a refit variant of sorts). The typical Fire Ant refit removed half a ton of armor in favor of six Machine Guns and three Flamers. It was thought to be a designated pacification unit, in the sense of a SecurityMech, as opposed to a frontline BattleMech design. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: When the Treaty of Taurus was signed, it established the New Colony Region in co-operation between the Magistracy of Canopus and the Taurian Concordat and also created the Colonial Marshals. By switching to double heat sinks, the 2L model of the Marshal is able to upgrade the LRM-5 launcher to a much more powerful LRM-15 launcher. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original:
Besides the 8D model the 6X was another experimental design by Kallon's Talon plant, intended as a fast-response anti-aircraft 'Mech and introduced in 3063. Its top speed was increased to 87 km/h through the use of a larger XL engine and its chassis replaced in favor of an Endo Steel model. It carried dual LB 10-X autocannons with four tons of ammunition, paired with ER Medium, and ER Small Lasers. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
A 'Project Phoenix' model built by Vicore Industries and introduced in 3066, the 7M was intended to act as a long-range sniper unit. It was armed with two Light Gauss Rifles, six ER Medium Lasers, a Small Laser, and a Guardian ECM Suite. Both the Blakists and the Free Worlds League used this Rifleman to provide protection to their command units. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The definitive 'Project Phoenix' model, the 8D is intended as more of a line unit. It mounts two Mydron Model RC Rotary Autocannon/5s with six tons of ammunition split between the arms, a pair of Bright-Blossom ER Medium Lasers also mounted in each arm, eleven double heat sinks and twelve tons of Kallon Royalstar armor, the heaviest of any known Rifleman variant. Until the arrival of the 7X, it was also the only known Rifleman variant to mount jump jets, with two in either leg for a total jumping distance of 120 meters. To carry all this additional weight, the 8D uses a Kallon Type XV Endo Steel chassis and Hermes 240 XL engine, although it still mounts the same excellent Garret electronics. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The Stealth is a heavy scout 'Mech that is in use by the Federated Suns and the Lyran Alliance. The 'Mech has a GM 315 XL Engine that allows the Stealth to move at speeds of 118.8 kph and the MASC system on board can push the 'Mech to 151.2 kph in short bursts. This amazing mobility is augmented by jump jets which the Stealth can use to jump up to two hundred and ten meters. The Stealth is also outfitted with a Cyclops-Beagle Sensory Active Probe that the Stealth can use to find hidden enemy units. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The Stealth is a heavy scout 'Mech that is in use by the Federated Suns and the Lyran Alliance. The 'Mech has a GM 315 XL Engine that allows the Stealth to move at speeds of 118.8 kph and the MASC system on board can push the 'Mech to 151.2 kph in short bursts. This amazing mobility is augmented by jump jets which the Stealth can use to jump up to two hundred and ten meters. The Stealth is also outfitted with a Cyclops-Beagle Sensory Active Probe that the Stealth can use to find hidden enemy units. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: The 3S variant of the Stealth is built using reverse engineered Stealth Armor. The 'Mech is armed with a single ER PPC which has a very long range. The ER PPCs long range and the Stealth Armor combine to make the 3S an almost perfect sniper 'Mech.

content.original: The Vulcan II VLC-N3 is roughly similar in layout to its predecessor. The N3 offers several new internal features, starting with its 280 extra light fusion engine and seven jump jets. The combination of an XL engine and an Endo Steel chassis permits the new design to carry eight and a half tons of Armor. The weaponry is equally impressive, the Vulcan II is equipped with 4 Small Pulse Lasers and 3 Medium Pulse Lasers. Finally, the techs installed eleven double heat sinks, enough to allow a Vulcan II pilot to run and fire all his weapons without overheating. However, jumping poses a problem for careless MechWarriors, and can quickly disable those who ignore the heat meter during a battle. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: The Vulcan II VLC-N4M trades a Medium Pulse Laser for an Anti-Missile System and CASE. Short-Range Missiles are often the most common anti-'Mech weapon encountered at the infantry level, and so an AMS would increase the Vulcan II's survivability at little cost to its effectiveness. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: The VT-7M retains the Endo Steel skeleton and fusion engine of the VT-5M. However, technicians considered its jump capacity more than sufficient for urban combat, and so reduced it to 120 meters. The weight and space saved by removing the two Jump Jets allows the design to carry seven and one half tons of Ferro-Fibrous Armor, the most protection this 'Mech has had at any time in its history. Furthermore, this is the first Vulcan to feature hand actuators. The new design features a Diverse Optics Extended Range Large Laser in the right torso and replaces the traditional arm-mounted Flamer with two Magna Medium Lasers, giving this Vulcan the punch to take on vehicles and light 'Mechs. A quartet of Magna Mk II Small Pulse Lasers fits snugly into the left arm; power conduits for this accurate anti-personnel array are routed along the same channel once used to feed that arm's single Machine Gun. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02
